description:
Great Thai food for takeout. They cover all the basics with no frills. Fast and tasteful. I regularly have the green curry with chicken. 

Environment is intimate but I rarely eat at the restaurant.
author: Barron C.

description:
I've had thai style crab fried rice (kao pad boo) hundreds of times in Thailand and here. It's my comfort food. This is the worst I've ever had! If it was only unauthentic bland and americanized I could live with it, I'm used to that. This place adds something that tastes like wasabi, and very well could be, that overwhelms and has no business in the dish. 

If they can screw up a basic and simple thai dish so thoroughly I have no faith in their ability to make anything else.
author: Manny F.

description: Their delivery person Diego is awful. We ordered delivery, he "called", hung up, then wouldn't answer calls and sent a series of ridiculous texts but had already left. There was plenty of parking etc., it made no sense. No response when we tried to get refunded either. I do not know how they choose their delivery services but we will never order delivery from here again.
author: Nazee M.

description:
When you step into Lemon Grass, it looks more upscale than your usual Thai restaurant but you're still going to get that predictable quality of food you'd expect from any other hole-in-the-wall.

The price is respectable for a majority of the dishes with a few outliers on their menu that warrants a higher cost and the reason why this place is two dollar signs on Yelp. The service is quick and you get generous portions of whatever it is you order that I guarantee will fill you up. As for quality, it's not gourmet by any means but it isn't too pedestrian either. With five friends dining here, after sampling everything family style, I'd strongly recommend the green curry with chicken if you end up here. Rice isn't included in the entree so you'll have to order a bowl on your own.
author: Jonathan N.

description:
Came here after advice from an uber driver (might have been my first mistake) that raved about Lemon Grass being his favorite thai place in the city. One night babysitting, I ordered Beef pad see ew and the fried calamari. 

Fried calamari - 1/5.... definitely not squid. disappointing to say the least, frozen, rubbery, gross. Do not order! Unless you enjoy faux calamari. 

Beef pad see ew - 3/5... average takeout thai 

I doubt I'll ever eat here again, it's okay takeout, but there are definitely better options out there!
author: Whitney P.

description: Wow!  I've eaten at dozens of Thai restaurants from NYC to Europe and this was the cream of the crop!  The atmosphere is nice and relaxing and the food is just AMAZING and authentic.  We will go here every time we visit San Fran!
author: Glenn S.

description: Lemon Grass has always been at the top of my list for Thai but recently I was using the app Eat24 slid to grub hub by Yelp and saw that LG raised their delivery limit to $25 and added a $3.00 delivery charge. To me that enough that I'm paying the higher item prices for the delivery convenience but require the delivery and minimum total of $25 when it used to be $15 is too much so I personally will not be ordering from Lemon Grass Thai no longer.
author: David W.

description: Stopped by on a whim... great little place! Excellent service! The pineapple fried rice was a great dish. Also had the chicken Satay and Meng Sum!!!
author: Liz C.

description:
I'd rate the food a 4- or 5-star.  But if not the worst service I've ever in my life experienced it ranks the next one to the worst. 

To be fair, they were probably down a server tonight -  I am pretty sure it was a bus-person that took our order and bussed the tables.

They seem far more focused on their take-out business than on their in-house clientele.  In fact, the food is good enough that we may never set foot in the restaurant again - but may order delivery.

Service was slow.  We got the initial drinks we ordered but not the second order (but weren't charged - so they got that right).  After the appetizers there were couples that were seated, ate their meal, paid and left before someone came and asked if we were ready for our main course!  When we were done, with all the obvious signs of being done - napkins off our laps and on the table, silver ware appropriately off the table and on the plates, plates moved aside etc.  it was impossible to get anyone to come give our check.  Even the clue of a credit card on the table was to no avail.

Eventually, I gave up and went up to the lady at the cash register (who was attending to many screens from companies like GrubHub) to pay and get our leftovers packaged.  And *still* it took a long time to finish checking out.  They insisted on packaging our leftovers - even though I would have been glad to do so.  After I'd paid and waited ten minutes or so, I was about to walk out of the restaurant without our leftovers when they finally were handed to us.

Summary:  Great food.  At least tonight - worst service ever.  Maybe they should become a deliver-only restaurant :-)
author: Brian B.

description:
Really great for a quick and inexpensive dinner. Will warn you that the food isn't really that authentic and it's not super tasty, but it is a great spot to get fed a ton of food for under $15.

All of the mains on their menu (everything from curries to stir fries to noodle dishes etc) is around $12, with a lot clocking in at $10. Their appetizers range from a few dollars to $14 for a sample platter, and their soups are $6-$7.

With prices like this you'd imagine that the portions would be stingy, but our table really over ordered this philosophy. I opted for a papaya salad and a bowl of Tom Yum soup and had to leave half the salad on the table- others in the group tried the hot beef salad and shrimp pad thai. Everything could have used a bit more spice and flavor in general, but again, good value for what you're paying for.
author: Elliott W.

description:
We've ordered takeout at work from Lemongrass and have been pretty satisfied with the food and speedy delivery. 

The pad thai is always a familiar and popular crowd-pleaser. I appreciate that it's not overly sweet like other places. I like the red curry duck. The duck imparts a gamier flavor to the curry and they do a good job of not overcooking the duck to where it is really tough. Nice rich and fatty flavor. The chicken yellow curry is a nice choice if you're looking for a less spicy curry. Nice variety of stir fry dishes too especially seafood and veggies. Order the appetizer combo to start if you want a little of everything. I like the fried veggie spring rolls for textural contrast. Also make sure to add on a side of the bright cucumber salad to break up all the wonderful curries. 

Lemongrass Thai Cuisine is a safe choice for a group but also has a few surprises in the menu to keep things fresh.
author: Jon L.

description: Best priced restaurant in the neighborhood! The portions are copious-- not the most amazing tasting pad see ew but everything else I've had was delicious. I recommend trying the spicy chicken soup or one of the curries!
author: Sara L.

description: The spicy green curry is INCREDIBLE. I don't even order rice with it because it's so good. The coconut chicken soup is also great. I was feeling sick and had a spicy Thai craving, and it was exactly what I needed. I came back to try the Pad Thai and it also hit the spot. The staff is also super nice and accommodating - definitely will be back.
author: Nicole P.

description: Stumbled upon this Thai restaurant and it was a great find! Thom Kha soup was great (not spicy at all which I missed a little but the flavor was delish) chicken fried rice was yummy, veggie rolls so good. Definitely will be coming back!
author: Milena F.

description: I love the coconut soup for this place. I ordered off of Yelp and though it took a long time to get delivered to my place of work, it was worth the wait. The soup isn't very big (small in fact) but it is so hearty and filling that I didn't feel hungry afterward. The price is what's to be expected in SF. The chicken satay is good too, if soup isn't your thing.
author: Jessica D.

description: Great take out food. Travels well, tastes delicious, very fresh, and super quick service. The portions are really big too. Not too expensive and their delivery is really efficient. The restaurant is nice as well.
author: Aleem C.

description:
Great atmosphere. Good spicy Thai food. What more can you ask for? 

Recommend the Tom Kha Gai soup!
author: Judy H.

description: Ketchup based Pad Thai aka Western Thai food. If you are looking for authentic Thai cuisine, this is not your place.
author: Alex B.

description: For someone who is really picky about Thai food, this place is pretty solid. Some menu items aren't the best I've had- the Tom Ka is lacking. But for the most part it's a really consistent restaurant with kind waitresses and quick service. Definitely a favorite of mine!
author: Emily H.

description: I have been exploring what is on Polk St. since I work on Van Ness and checking out all that Polk has to offer. I stopped by this place, there weren't a lot of people but nice ambiance. The service was great. I ordered their special soft shell crab and it was delicious. I had a very relaxing meal and will go back if I am in that area again.
author: A C.

description:
My friend and I were seated for a table for two in the back of the dining room. It was a bustling Wednesday night during supper time. The hostess sat us right away and promptly brought us menus. 

We ordered a papaya salad, pad Thai, and a chicken coconut soup. The portions for the salad and pad Thai were pretty big and perfect for sharing. In fact, the salad and half the pad Thai made for a great leftovers lunch! The flavors and food consistencies were spot on and the salad want too spicy/inedible like some traditional Thai places.

One minor come complaint we had was the terribly loud landline phone on the hostess stand near our table. It was positioned right next to our ears and rang constantly! It was pretty distracting.
author: Andrea H.

description: This place is the absolute worst. The last time I ordered from them I ordered at 6:30pm and the food arrived at 8:35pm. I called about six times to check on it and they kept saying it was coming. No apologies, no offer to refund. When I asked for a refund they didn't understand what I was saying and hung up the phone. This is the second time they've been more then 30 minutes late with a scheduled delivery. DON'T ORDER DELIVERY FROM HERE!
author: foodbot c.

description: Dropped by during lunch on Saturday and it was kind of empty. However, there was a solid specials menu that most neighborhood Thai places do not have. We had the prawn pumpkin curry and the honey roasted duck. Both were great -- the duck came with a nice assortment of veggies over a stone skillet and the pumpkin curry was good though the shrimp could have been higher quality. The price was on the higher side though... we ended up spending $50 for lunch but it was an excellent meal. We'll probably come back for dinner next time. They should probably drop prices for lunch to attract more customers.
author: Young Y.

description:
Thai restaurants are plentiful -- except in Russian Hill. Previously, there was a Thai restaurant On Broadway & Polk that was my favorite but it closed due to an extreme rent increase ;(
Lemongrass has a lock down on Thai cuisine in the area because that closure. I had the Lemongrass Special Noodle Soup tonight. The top of the bowl has a lot of the seafood strewn across it (shrimp, calamari, fish cake). I found there was not enough soup (which I was looking forward to because of the chilly temps outside). The calamari pieces were really hard & overcooked. 
As I said the taste was okay.
The service also was just okay.
The servers don't ask you if you are okay and tend to leave you alone with the food unless they see you ordering a lot.
If you're in this 'hood and you're craving Thai, sure give this place a try.
author: Joanna T.

description:
#Pineapple Fried Rice : Replaced meat by tofu, but it tasted like its oily and cashew taste all over. Not felt like authentic Thai fried rice. It was less spicy, they don't have any option or spice level. so we added chilly sauce.

#Vegetarian fried Rice : We omitted eggs, tasted good. Better than Pineapple fried rice.

#Ambience and location is good, walking distance from van ness area.
author: Gemini J.

description: Some food is so good, but some so-so.  We used to go to LG more often  at its original location years back when it became known as "the" Thai place to go to.  Haven't gone as often, but when we have it's been fine. We got some food to go last night.  Some dishes were a hit, and I even had to finish off the salad first thing this morning because it was so tasty (I almost got out of bed in the middle of the night to eat it). The Tom Kha Gai soup was a little too white and wanted more depth, but it was good.  Veggie dish with pea pods--yum.  Duck fried rice--yum (and I normally don't care for duck). The dish that was a problem was the egg rolls.  They were spoiled.  And I knew something was off even as we were walking out the door of the restaurant. I could smell spoilage.  But as luck would have it, my companion said I was wrong and he was sure things would be good, and I just gave in and said okay. Back home, as we removed the containers from the bag, the kitchen filled with the smell of the spoiled dish.  It was the group of three egg rolls in a carton.  The restaurant kitchen actually sliced the middle roll down its center for presentation.  How could they not have known that there was something wrong?  I find it impossible to believe that, between the person who cooked the food, the person who boxed it, the person who placed the bag out on the table where carry-outs were waiting, and the cashier, someone didn't detect the spoiled smell.  I also can't help but wonder if they were giving the freshest egg rolls to customers who were dining in and the older rolls to to-go customers, so only to-go customers had spoiled rolls that they, like us, didn't want to be bothered going back to LG to return, or if even some people in the dining room had bad rolls.  The egg rolls weren't that expensive.  But we did spend over sixty bucks for a meal whose appetizer was immediately tied up in a compost bag.  We'll give it another try, and if it's all good we'll go back again--if not, never again.  Every now and then any restaurant can goof up.
author: E C.

description:
This place stinks, waited 30+ minutes for 3 Togo orders. The place is not even busy. All other sit in got their food even came in after. Will not recommended it.

On another note, worst "fired rice" I've ever had, it's so moist, it can't call fried rice, it should call "stir rice" instead...
author: Warren W.

description: Decent, cheap Thai. Delish Egg Rolls, and Pad Thai isn't too bad. Worth trying their curries too, although closer to northern Thai food, bordering on Indian styled curries.
author: Jack B.

description: I love asian food and I came here once and the soup i got it was very delicious and tasty. At the moment this restaurant is my favourite on the list!!!
author: Monika B.

description:
***************************** 1438 ***************************

   We walked by here on the Fleet Week weekend. I smelt the lemongrass and we walked in. We were surprised to know that they have been serving guests since 1994, in this Russian Hill District restaurant, same chef and owner.

   Thai curries, fresh seafood dishes, spicy noodle soups and flavorful, traditional vegetarian fare. Chef uses fresh ingredients, a unique balance of flavors and an exquisite combination of spices, Lemongrass Thai Cuisine satisfies any Thai craving.

- SILVER NOODLES YUM - Silver noodles, mushrooms, red onion, green onion, cilantro, crispy tofu, and chili in lime juice.

-  PO TAK  Spicy and sour soup with combination of seafood was very good. 

- YUM WOON SEN Tasty silver noodles, fresh ground chicken, shrimp, mushroom, and onion seasoned with chili paste in lime juice was perfect.

- MOO YANG Pork, marinated and grilled, served with sweet chili sauce. This was perfectly grilled.

-  MIENG-KUM A very special Thai appetizer prepared with roasted coconut, peanuts, ginger, red onion, spinach leaves, lime, and dried shrimp in our delightful Thai herb sauce. This street food dish was delicious. I don't find this dish around the Bay Area much.

  Service was good. Price is so reasonable here. We will definitely come back.
author: Manda Bear B.

description: Good food, friendly service, nice for takeout.  Pumpkin curry and salmon green curry are great, something in the brown rice too.  Great diet cokes, wonderful napkins, phenomenal ambience
author: Alexander B.

description:
The restaurant is nice, with pleasant decor and friendly staff. 

The Hot Beef Salad is chewy and crunchy and tastes fresh. Cool and crispy, it's flavorful and has an irresistible crunch. Very tasty. Oh, and did I mention that the beef is also crispy? Delicious.

The Pad Makuer Tofu is sweet and tasty but a little too salty in my opinion. The tofu could use some more time to soak the flavor, but it was also very good. Cutting the tofu into smaller pieces would have made the dish much better.

Overall a great meal with delicious food. I recommend it if you're in the area.
author: Andrew F.

description: Amazing service! Delicious food. Not oily at all! I'm Super happy here. Great atmosphere. Perfect place for both family gathering or date night. Highly recommended.
author: tiffany c.

description:
If you like frozen, prepackaged food heated up, then this is the place for you. Calamari frozen with onion ring breading, heck it could of been onion rings from a fast food restaurant.  Steamed won tons were very similar to Trader Joe's potstickers....actually I think they were!  Papaya salad with no flavor and not fresh...
I will not be returning and recommend going to a number of other Thai places further down Polk or anywhere else in the city!
author: Davis M.

description:
This place used to be better. Came here for a quick bite with friend after not having been here for a few years, and got Kung Kra Praw (Basil Shrimp). The taste was a little off - can't quite put my finger on it, but didn't have that rich, spicy basil flavor you want from a Thai basil dish. It was spicy, but the basil flavor wasn't strong. Also, my friend's portion and my portion were very different sizes, though both entrees. 

Probably still reliable Thai, but the basil dishes here used to be my favorite. Would be 2* for this experience alone, but rounding up to 3 for the great Thai I've had here before. BRING IT BACK!
author: Sarah B.

description: Soup was really sour, soft shell crab was OK and trout was drowning in sweet sauce without any flavor, just soy and sugar. Service was really bad, asked for jasmine tea and got black tea, had to repeat myself multiple times to correct my order. Do not recommend.
author: Andrei S.

description: Good classic Thai food, fried rice and the curries are both up to par. Haven't tried much else but it's quality food.
author: Noah W.

description: I was getting a little nervous reading the reviews about the pad thai, but once we got it, DAMN IT WAS GOOD. Perfect texture/consistency/taste/serving. I'm glad we gave this place a chance. It wasn't busy at all on a Friday around 2.
author: Paige D.

description:
Awful food ! I ordered pad kee Mao to pick up. 
They literally didn't cook the meal, just threw some ingredients to make it look like a dish and some sweet and sour soup. 
First of all they didn't even give me the right order. 
There were literally two piece small of red pepper. And sorry looking few days old few piece broccoli and some other noodles but not the flat noodles 
They stole my money for awful food !
author: Hemali Z.

description: We were visiting from out of town and decided to get some takeout from a place nearby. Everything was delicious and reasonably priced. The restaurant itself looked pleasant as well for dine in. Highly recommend!
author: Alison H.

description:
While I was waiting for my take out order, I saw the waitress go straight from handling credit card payments into the kitchen to garnish an order, with her bare hands, without washing them first.

If, for some reason, you're still reading this and haven't been convinced to go elsewhere, let me further try to persuade you to do so. Service is incredibly slow, partly because the waitresses write what seem to be entire essays on their order notepads, and partly because said orders seem to be mostly takeout, and there's a mad scramble to figure out which dishes go to whom. My own pickup time was quoted at 30 minutes, and ended up being 10 minutes late. While waiting, I heard the estimated time had gone up to 1 hour. This is all with a dining room that was half full.

Food itself was also subpar. Granted, I only got one dish, so I won't generalize this to all of their food, but the pad kee mao was way over salted.
author: Richard Z.

description: This place is an ok place to get Thai food if you're craving it. We got the tom kha soup with chicken which was very flavorful but a bit on the salty side. I do wish there were more vegetables in it though. I also got the yellow curry which was a pretty solid curry. Service was ok and the place was pretty nice and well kept.
author: Angela Y.

description:
I have been a loyal customer of Lemongrass for about 15 years. I work in a nearby business and have ordered from them regularly. Tonight I called and was told that I am not in their delivery area. After a back and forth they agreed to take my order.

I placed the order and it came to $19 before tax and tip. They said it did not meet their $20 minimum. Then they asked if it was OK to charge me an additional $3 charge because it was too small an order and it was "so far away". It's about a mile away...maybe.

Seriously? 

If this is how they want to treat their long time customers, well...you can count me out. 

I just won't continue to send business their way. 

Sad. I hope this new business model works for them.
author: Monet A.

description: Food is not authentic at all, period. Way too much sugar, especially the Tom Yon Gong soup with no mushroom nor shrimp, is probably the worst I had. The Pinot Noir tasted like cheap Port. Did the $40 tasting menu, a total failure in every dish. 2 stars for the decent ambiance and service. Will not come back.
author: Yibang C.

description: Came here after a hike around 1pm on a Sunday.  Not many people, so it was perfect for a big group like ours.  We ordered and the food came quickly.  Overall the dishes were decent and reasonably priced.  Nothing really stood out, so I may not go back.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
A friend and I decided to get Thai here. We usually meet at Thai Spice which is closer to my house, but this time decided to try this Thai restaurant closer to her house. I'm glad we did! The service here is just so nice. The wait staff and bussers are so attentive with a sweet manner to them. It was very noticeable to us that the service here was extra nice. It seemed like an authentic Thai manner. 

As for the food, we really enjoyed it. She ordered the 3 course meal (which had more than 3 things to it -- more like 5), and I ordered the red curry and rice and we shared it all. It was a lot of food for the 2 of us, and I think we enjoyed every bite. We finished everything but were stuffed!

We felt nicely looked after, not rushed, and I'd definitely recommend this Thai restaurant. :)
author: Cuppy C.

description: Very good Thai food with very friendly service. Love the Rainbow Trout and the Tofu Basil.
author: R T.

description: Good food and the service is good, just didn't blow me away. The soup was delicious as well as the noodles. Prices were average, but nothing I haven't had before.
author: Aya O.

description: Wow. Everything was crumptious. But I can never remember the dishes names. The mussels were incredible. Our grand daughter is already a foodie- it was her choice! We over ordered as us my don't, but everything was delightful.
author: Geanr L.

description:
This place does the trick for take out. Try the pad see ew with chicken!

I recently called and it looks like it is closed for renovations.
author: Vicky H.

description:
Better for take out then sit down. 
The decor is a bit older with sticky tables and bad commercial carpet. 

Food was a good 3 stars 
The Pad See-Ew with beef was wonderful. 
The Lemongrass Special Noodles was just ok.   The soup base was very sweet. 

MINUS 1 STAR -   BUGS in the hot sauce. I take a star off for cleanliness!

I was scooping hot peppers into my soup noodles and found two bugs in the sauce. Disgusting!!  They did replace my soup. I hope they keep a better eye on cleanliness.
author: VIOLA L.

description:
Solid Thai food. All the curries and things you would expect.

Prawn pumpkin curry is A-mazing!!! Get it. Ask for "spicy" and you'll be happy! Kind service. No trendy decor but definitely worth stopping by if in the area.
author: Semuteh F.

description: Cozy dining spot in Russian Hill; intimate setting with great decor and friendly staff.  Several delicious Thai options to choose from including some beers like Singha and Chang.  The pork himaparn was tasty and plentiful.
author: Wild J.

description: My husband and I came here for dinner tonight on Valentine's day because we always walk by the restaurant and mention about coming back to try since we've eaten here once many years ago before they remodeled. There was also no wait so we decided tonight would be a good night to go in. There were four other tables and it didn't seem too busy, although they did have some to go orders which I think they were taking care of rather than taking care of customers eating in the restaurant. The fried egg rolls came out very fast and was just ok it could've been hotter. It just didn't taste fresh. I think it may had been a mistake order given that it came out fairly fast. Then we waited and waited for our entrees. We probably waited for about 30 minutes + for a pale looking pad see ew. It tasted ok and was probably the best dish tonight. I love pad see ew so I'm generally not very picky about it. This was mediocre. My husbands curry fried rice lacked flavor and only tasted a bit of spice other than that it tasted like plain rice. The waitress didn't apologize for the wait until we were given the check. If the food was pretty good I would probably come back but based on tonight's experience we won't be coming back.
author: Tinker B.

description: I have been comming here for years. They have the best green curry in SF. They use tons of vegetables and eggplants in the curry and it is my favorite dish. I would also recommend the chicken satay with the peanut sauce. Really good!
author: vahid r.

description: I got food poisoning from the spicy chicken noodle soup. I tried this place for the first time a couple days ago and started getting sick not too long after dinner. It's been 2 days and I'm barely recovering. I will never visit again.
author: Jen K.

description:
Two stars for "Double Tipping" aside from the slow service and okay food.

Me and a group of people went at 530.  They did not have any other table, but everything took a while to get, especially the check.  Having worked in a restaurant, I was very forgiving of the service cause I assumed they lacked the training.  When they brought us the check, and I mean, they did not bring an itemized check or we had given our credit card first.  Again, being a waiter, I was sympathetic and left 15% (thats what I do for generally bad service).   However, when I asked if gratuity was included, they said yes.  It floored me because they charged me a tip already and I was going to give them another 15%.  Double tipping is a pitiful way to charge the customer double tips, leading to the waiter actually profiting, even if they did not provide good service. That is why they did not provide an itemized receipt.   

I am going to give it 2 starts and not 1 because I am assuming the owner discourages double-tipping and cares about his customers. Yet, the waitresses were well aware of what they were doing.
author: Dishar R.

description:
Neighborhood gem. 

Great food. Great service!

Ask for the green curry or the pad Thai!
author: Wael D.

description: This is simply the worst Thai food that I ever had.  Don't waste your money and time.
author: James B.

description:
Sometimes the reviews might not be that great but you just got to try for yourself and see if it really is THAT bad.  In this case, it really was THAT bad.  Or at least my dish was. 

The pad see ew was not flavorful and the texture was completely off. 

I will not be coming back.  Thank you.
author: Michelle T.

description: Speciality and curry dishes do not come with rice. A bowl of rice costs 4 dollars!!! They should have let us know when we tried to order. And it was not even particularly good and the portion was quite small. After we received the credit card copy, the staff told us "just to sign it, the total has already included all the service charges." Then we were like how the fuck can you decide how much tips we want to pay.
author: Benjamin I.

description: Love lemongrass so much. The Thai toast is bomb. Also the chicken special w peanut sauce is amazing
author: Gabby O.

description: Solid place. Super clean inside, food comes out pretty fast. My only gripe is that sometimes the Tom Yum or Tom Ka soup I've ordered is too salty or the curry (red or green) is too sweet. But this issue isn't a consistent one and doesn't deter me from eating there. This place is definitely worth checking out and a solid choice if you live in the area.
author: Lyle Z.

description: I've ordered delivery from Lemongrass for the past 3 years. I guess you could say this restaurant is a bit nostalgic for me it was the very first meal I ever had when I first moved into my new apartment here in SF. They have excellent Tom Kah soup and their Pad Thai is delicious. My husband really enjoys the Chicken Satay appetizer with the peanut dipping sauce the Pad See Ew. Overall: Good quality, arrives hot, very consistent, large portions, quick delivery service, and very satisfying. Give them a try!
author: Sarah R.

description:
The only thing I'm reviewing is the Pad Thai.
It was not good.  The noodles had some unrecognizable pinkish red coating but the only flavor that came through was that of plain noodles.  Pad Thai from a frozen dinner would have been much better than what I got from Lemmongrass
author: lex j.

description:
The Fried rice salad was awesome. It's not on all of the menu's. Highly recommend it. 

Other than that we only had their ginger tofu with peppers and mushroom. It's lightly flavored and minimally sauced. It doesn't have the full flavor one might expect from a Thai dish. The ginger didn't really stand out so wouldn't recommend it. 

Only giving three stars because that dish was pretty weak but possibly if I had the fried rice salad and something else would have been a 4 or 5.
author: Brad S.

description:
Ordered delivery....
Pad thai with shrimp (spicy) and red curry with chicken (spicy)...both were quite good...The spiciness level was about a 6.  It doesn't make your mouth burn, but you notice that there is a little bit of heat.  Food was fresh and non-greasy.  I would order again.
author: Nicolas G.

description:
I've only had their delivery and I've only ever ordered one thing but this one dish is amazing. 

The Lemongrass chicken savory is delicious. I always ask for no cabbage at the bottom because that doesn't cook well the next day for leftovers. However, this dish is so flavorful. It has veggies, chicken and it's all tossed up in a spicy peanut sauce and there are always leftovers. I really enjoy it. The spring rolls aren't my favorite but the main dish makes up for it.
author: Jordan S.

description:
Came here hoping to get some half decent Thai food according to the 3.5 star rating this place has, but left sorely disappointed.

I ordered the tom kha gai and pad thai, and both were tremendously disappointing. The tom kha gai tasted like it had too much fish sauce in it, which is odd because usually tom kha is not made with fish sauce to my knowledge. It was weirdly too sweet and too salty with not enough sour and I had to ask for some limes to try to balance out the flavor of the soup, which worked to a small degree.

The pad thai wasn't much better, they have large portions but the pad thai was really off; it was sickly sweet, not enough peanut flavor and the noodles were thicker and stickier than I am accustomed to. 

To quote another reviewer's comments on this place (Sandman D.), I'd "rate the food quality to be ordinary at the best.  I would give it 3.5 stars....but out of 10."
author: Tina H.

description:
Yummm. Came here the other day for lunch and ordered one of their specials. I got the eggplant, peppers, shrimp and brown rice. It was really tasty, came out quickly and service was prompt and professional. There is nothing outstanding about the interior and decorations of this restaurant, but the food speaks for itself.

There was some weirdness when the bill came. It was my meal, plus tax. Then the server took it away, came back and it was $2 higher for some reason. I'm guessing the $2 was for the brown rice- they should have explained what happened instead of just being awkward and coming back with a higher bill. Not a big deal and will be back for more lunches here.
author: Christine E.

description: I have mixed feelings about this restaurant. I went yesterday with friends who are visiting from New York and wanted to have Thai food. Considering the reviews posted outside the door, this seemed like the best place to go to. However, I am not so sure it was the best choice. For appetizer we ordered vegetable rolls which tasted like they had been previously microwaved. We ordered seltzer water with lemon and instead got sparkling water, the lemon were what would be half of a half for all four of us. The food on the other hand, was a lot more tasty. The portion were reasonable, as well as flavorful. Overall I give this place 4 stars. Fast service, Clean space, friendly waiters.
author: Aishah S.

description: I've loved Lemongrass since the day I moved to the city. Their dishes are consistently good and I love that they can deliver! My favorite is the Pad Thai with shrimp. SO GOOD! I also like the vegetable spring rolls. The fried rice is great too. It's a little bit expensive but I don't mind because everything reheats very well so I eat it all week :)
author: Julia M.

description: had the green curry pork and the tom yum kung. both dishes were made fresh and with quality ingredients. atmosphere was nice and clean. service was ok.
author: mykolray o.

description: This place is pretty bad. The green curry doesn't have enough coconut milk or flavor in general. The Thai stock was way too salty and just gross. Portions are extremely small, so I ended up spending double what I expected to spend.
author: Jessica P.

description:
We came here for dinner the other night, and I was more than happy to try another Thai spot. The place is fairly big for being in San Francisco, and we had no problem getting a table around 7 on Sunday night. 

My sister ordered a Thai iced tea, which was ok. I'm pretty picky when it comes to Thai iced tea, and I thought this one was on the sweet side. 

I ordered the savory special for my entree, which was basically chicken with a spicy peanut sauce, veggies and a side of rice. I love chicken satay, and I was really looking forward to a spicy version of it, but I guess I was expecting something different than what I got. The sauce had way too much peanut butter for my taste. My sister had a noodle dish that was pretty good, and my dad got the asparagus special was was delicious. It was really fresh, with a light, favorable sauce. Let's just say I had plate envy. 

The portions were generous, and we took leftovers home. The service was also good, the woman who waited on us was very nice. 

Moral of the story, get the aparagus special...
author: Ashley S.

description: This restaurant used to be good.  Today's lunch was at best mediocre, at worst almost inedible.  Four of us each ordered different dishes.  None were good.  I guess it could have been just a bad day but we won't be back to see.
author: Barbara W.

description:
It was the very first time my family went to try this place for dinner, we are all so pleased with how excellent the food taste here. The staffs were very nice and checked in on us regularly throughout to make sure we have water or if there is anything else we needed etc. 
The Owner and Chef Toi is one of the nicest person I ever met, she so lovely and makes really good food. I will definitely come back. 
In addition to this review, my company had a small party, I ordered catering food from here even if it's a short notice and my coworker enjoyed the food so much. Thank you Toi and to your staff!
author: Mary Grace C.

description: Just okay. Not the cheapest but not horribly over priced. Service was a little slow, while we were the only two in there. Probably wouldn't try again.
author: Sarah L.

description: Delicious Thai food with great flavors. When I don't feel like cooking but don't want to order greasy Chinese takeout, this is my spot.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Food was ok, not great. Service was one of the worse I ever had. Never coming back. 

Server looked unhappy. 

Chicken was overcooked.
author: Cesar G.

description: The old one was underwhelming but the new is worse.  Service is slow and when it happened it is mediocre.  Food portions are small for the price and very bland.  We ordered one mixed vegetable with bean sauce and a curry.  The mixed vegetables lacked variety, just your most common brocolli, carrot, and that's about it. Thai Spice up the street has at leave six variety of veggies in the same dish with at least 20% larger portion, around the same price.  The curry also lacked dimension and solid ingredients.  Bummer, I was hoping for an improvement from the former but I guess that wasn't to be.  I'm going to walk a little further to Thai Spice for my Thai food fix, or just order delivery from there..
author: H. L.

description: Warning: do not go here. Eating, undoubtedly, the worst Thai food we've ever had. The shrimp toasts were like eating sponges soaked in oil. The pad Thai had almost nothing but noodles and a so so red sauce and 3 prawns. The yellow curry was edible but watery. Completely disappointing. Don't bother.
author: Heather S.

description:
Authentic feel, friendly staff.  Menu has a variety of Thai dishes.  Ordered Chicken Basil with Thai Sticky Rice.  Nicely seasoned, spiced well.

Peaceful place, low noise level.  

The Thai Ice Tea was good as well.
author: A J.

description:
Came here for lunch. I heard of Lemongrass somewhere before so I was like hey lets try it! It has to be good if I have heard of it before. 

We walk in and the decor is so cute! They had this sofa seating on the right and each section was sectioned off by this armrest pillow. (see picture) I have never experienced anything like it. As you can tell, small things make me happy. 

We arrived shortly after noon and there was two by the window. I, of course, sat at a table with the sofa seating and the armrest.  

We both ordered from the combination rice plates. $8.75 and you get to pick two items out of 6 choices. Comes with rice. 

I ordered the chicken satay with pad pak ruammit (sauteed mixed vegetables with bean sauce) - two pieces of chicken satay which was probably the best thing I had at this place. Although you get a lot of veggies, it was sauteed in msg. It was very salty and I was dying of thirst 2 hours later. I did like the little sauce plate that held peanut sauce and tiny pieces of celery. 

My friend ordered the chicken satay also and the Kang Karee with Chicken (A mild yellow curry with chicken, coconut milk,  potatoes, and onions) - The yellow curry was watered down. 

Before our entrees arrived we were each given a small salad. The salad was not very thai and not very good. 

One bathroom. The bathroom itself is separated from the sink by a door. Pretty clean and nice sink. 

Overall, I don't think either one of us will be returning. The only thing that was Thai that we had was the chicken satay. My veggies tasted like it was poorly made Chinese food.
author: Sarah C.

description: We went for dinner to this newly renovated restaurant under new owners and were quite pleased. The dark and somewhat cluttered interior has been updated with an open, bright and clean decor. The staff is friendly, polite and attentive. The menu is apparently unchanged for the time being and the dished we ordered were excellent. All items were served with a minimum wait time. The Hot Beef Salad was very fresh and crisp with just the right combination of spicy and sweet flavors. The salmon green curry was delicious and came with a generous portion of rice. And the Pattaya chicken had a wonderful combination of flavors. We will definitely return to try many more of the dishes on the menu!!!
author: Michael B.

description: I'm an Asparagus Lovers fan, but there are so many other great dishes here too.  This is my go to take out because they are fast, professional, and serve fresh, flavorful food, but I like going to the restaurant too. The service is always great, but low key. Never rushed.
author: Angela C.

description: This restraint had high quality service, and wonderful tasting fresh food. When I visited from out of town, I saw there restaurant. It looked cozy. Now every time I visit Petaluma I always go there for there delicious Thai food
author: Caleb L.

description:
Delicious! Good service great food!

I've never seen this appetizer at any Thai restaurant before. It is hands down my favorite. POH-PIER-SOD (Jay) A fresh rice paper roll stuffed with tofu, cucumber, snow peas, carrots and topped with sweet and sour tamarind sauce.

Very good: SEAFOOD COMBO Scallops and prawns sauteed with fresh garlic, eggplant and basil.

Delicious: PLA-JEAAN Filet snapper, deep fried and topped with mushrooms, onion, ginger and tamarind sauce.

Good flavor: SEAFOOD WON TON Shrimp, calamari, fish ball and fish cake in won ton soup.

I hope to be back in San Francisco again and I will definitely come back to Lemongrass!
author: Chan C.

description:
The food here is absolutely amazing! It's the best Thai food I have had so far in San Francisco. 

We went here last night with my husbands parents who are visiting and they were recommended this place by a customer coming out of the restaurant while they were looking at the menu. We were not disappointed. 

To start they brought out this amazing dish which was leaves with peanuts, noodle type sprinkled and a honey sauce that you rolled like a taco and ate. Delicious. 

We shared a few of the starters- egg rolls, calamari salad & deep fried calamari. All were perfect. 

For main I had a choice from the favorites menu. Lemongrass chicken which was chicken in a red curry and peanut sauce. I normally always go for massaman but this has knocked that off my number one list. The portion was so big. I was so happy that I could box the rest and enjoy again later. Everyone else had a prawn dish and loved it.  

The setting is very authentic and the service was very attentive. The place was very busy which is always a good sign. 

I can't wait to go back and try some more of the menu!
author: Kelly M.

description: Service was extremely slow. Called in for pick-up, said it would be 15-20 minutes, after 45 I finally got my food. Bike was stolen while I was inside the restaurant, I'm not bitter.
author: Byron M.

description:
Lovely staff!!!!
Super clean restaurant!!!!!
Yummy food!!!!
author: Page D.

description: Really romantic, tasteful and wonderful.  I went to an early Sunday dinner.  No crowd.  No muss no fuss! The food was divine.  Had a chicken curry that was the best!  Everything looked good.  The service was great.  Loved this place. Will go back.
author: Elisa B.

description: This is some great Thai food, and the staff is SUPER NICE!!!  I either get the Shrimp Pad Thai or the Pineapple fried rice.  Either is a great choice.  Abundant portions, friendly service, and tasty food combine for a great, local place.
author: Randall S. B.

description: It is true, Lemongrass is closed for renovations and will reopen with a new chef/owner. It's been my favorite Thai place for years. Last time I was home sick and ordered delivery, the chef/owner herself delivered the Thai chicken soup that made me all better. :). Toi certainly has earned her retirement. Hope to see her around the neighborhood and will definitely go back when it reopens.
author: C J.

description: We ordered one order of chicken and one order of beef pad see ew. It was fantastic. Highly recommend. We will definitely be back.
author: Amanda P.

description: Just arrive to San Fransisco. We were hungry. Just wanted to eat a desist Thai restaurant. This place is the worst Thai restaurant I ever went too. All the food tasted bland. My soup didn't taste like soup. It look like they just threw water and add the ingredients. The fried calamari look like they just reheated it. My Thai fried rices with beef. Didn't taste like anything. The service was even slow when there wasn't even any people at 900pm. Save your money and time. Don't go here.
author: Ruben M.

description: I bought pad thai with extra peanuts from this place which was actually not bad although they definitely could've been more generous with the peanuts. I wasn't particularly hungry so I ate only a little bit then put it in my friend's freezer for about two years. Unfortunately for me, the meal didn't keep and I ended up having to toss it
author: Benjamin D.

description: Not too happy with the new kitchen so far. First time back, pickup order took foreeeeeeever. Second time, simple order of Tom Kha Gai....well, it was ready, but for $12, they couldn't even fill the container (3/4 full). Seriously? Also, requested spicy and not even a chili flake to be seen. Chicken pieces were plentiful and of good size, but overall, not happy. Hoping this place gets in sync soon...
author: Jeremy B.

description:
I loved this place under their old management. It was tasty, prompt, and affordable.

Under new ownership, quality has drastically declined and it can take almost an hour to get your food. On top of that, the service is not welcoming.

The new Lemongrass is no longer a neighborhood staple.
author: Jack B.

description: This place really made my group and I swoon with delight. All the dishes were made very well, the seafood and Thai curry soup was absolutely amazing, along with their sauteed vegetables, particularly the eggplant, best prepared eggplant I have had in my life. The only room for improvement would be to provide a little bit more rice, but it's not a big deal. Great service, romantic decor, if your in the Russian Hill area and don't want to break the bank, give it try.
author: Dominic B.

description: This review is specifically for their red curry with chicken which I think is really good here. Not sure about other food since I'm hooked on that curry.
author: Maya S.

description: The weather calls for thai soup. We are visiting and did the yelp to find a good thai restaurant, this place came up with 4 stars. After getting our food and with the first taste it was not Thai food but American Thai. The worst Thai food I have had in a long time. Sooo sad!!
author: Chanmany T.

description: It's been a long time since I've eaten here, but I decided to try using Seamless for take out and deeply regretted it. I don't understand all the good reviews. I ordered Tom Kha Gai and Pad Thai and it tasted like they were trying to make it into dessert! It was sweeter than the apple and pumpkin pies I had at Thanksgiving. Perhaps they don't take as much care in their takeout orders as they do for dine-in orders? Otherwise, perhaps we really do have so much of a sugar addiction here that people want their savory dishes to be super sweet! I know that some Thai dishes are meant to be a little sweet, but this is ridiculous. Whatever the reason, I hated it and feel like I wasted my money.
author: Maria Y.

description: Crispy rice salad is amazing and worth the price of admission. Yellow curry tofu was kinda bland and the service was pretty slow. Will return for the salad!
author: Devanshu P.

description:
This is a cute small neighborhood restaurant with very nice Thai decor. However, the staffing is very low (probably family run) which leads to long wait for food and possibly other things. I came for lunch one day last week while in field assignment nearby. I was seated and at the time there was only one other table occupied, and I believe they already had their food. I ordered a tom yum beef noodle, and the wait seemed quite long for a noodle item for a place that wasn't busy. Also, while I was there, a party came in waiting to be greeted and seated, and apparently nobody did for so long such that one of them went to the kitchen calling for a staff.

The tom yum soup served with the noodle was pretty good, different from how it often tastes at other Thai restaurants. I'll give them much credit for that.

I'll say this is a good neighborhood spot, but if you're in a rush or if time the amount of time you have for the meal is a concern, then based in this first experience beware of coming here.
author: H K.

description: Some of the reviews do not do this place justice. Great Thai food at an affordable price.
author: Leandro S.

description:
If you've eaten good Thai food, this place is really not that good. One of the members of our party came close to saying that it was some of the worst they'd eaten, but that might be a bit of a stretch in my opinion. To be fair, service was really pretty good. Food came fast, and the waitresses seemed generally nice. They probably kept this from being a 1 star review.

We ordered the tom yum soup, satay chicken, pad thai, and 2 curries:

The soup was decent, but it was mostly undercooked vegetables and had very little actual soup in it. The soup that was there was only decent, lacking in flavor.

The satay chicken was particularly underwhelming. The seasoning didn't taste like satay chicken, and the chicken itself was tough to bite off the stick.

The pad thai continued the trend of having too many undercooked vegetables accompanying the plate. The noodles themselves were oily, and, while the entire dish tasted like pad thai, it was far from great.

The curries were actually not that bad, but they were also pretty generic. Another user mentioned that the curries didn't have the perfect spice blends that make Thai cuisine great, and they seemed to be spot on. The curries were pretty watery and were something that could have been made at home. A couple of the prawns in one of the curries were slightly undercooked.

Unless you're a regular and have gotten used to this being your fix of Thai, I wouldn't recommend coming here.
author: Ankit M.

description: Came here for dinner the other night with my boyfriend and his friend. We like to come to Thai places because they have meat options for him & veggie options for me. This place has a plethora of veggie options which is nice, however, the one I ordered was not good. I ordered the pad thai jay which basically pad thai with tofu. In general I don't mind asian sauces that are sweet, but the sauce on this dish was beyond sweet. It was so sweet I actually couldn't eat it, but I did end up bringing it home and dousing it in sriracha and lime juice which made it slightly better. Maybe their other veggie options are better?
author: Alexandra E.

description:
For sure rivals any Thai you think is the cities best. I come or order from here regularly and it really the best. Pad Thai to die for. 

The place is super fun to go to. The owner is great. Sweet little lady. Always cones around to check on you. If you become a regular, she'll come and have a little conversation with you. And she networks pretty well too. Introduced me to a client. 

Give it a try. You won't regret it.
author: Robert F.

description:
The menu selection was great and I have no complaints about the service. The atmosphere was perfect for a casual night to catch up with a  friend. Good prices for quality.

Unfortunately, I thought the food was underwhelming. I ordered the yellow curry with tofu. The curry itself was good, though I've definitely had better. I thought the veggies were slightly undercooked (for my taste) and under seasoned though they were very fresh. The tofu was really disappointing, though. It was way underseasoned and taste like it had come straight from a package.

My friend got a veggie roll type dish and it was ok as well.

Overall, a pretty average dining experience. Not terrible, but not exciting either.
author: Laura C.

description:
After helping me carry what seemed like an endless mountain of boxes into my new apartment, I took my boyfriend for a very late lunch/early dinner at Lemongrass. 

I ordered the red curry with beef, he ordered a noodle dish that was covered in gravy. Both were very tasty! Shockingly I preferred my food to his. Portions are fairly large which was good because we were hungry! 

I deducted a star for service. Granted, we were there during an awkward meal time, but no one came by to check on us, or refill our water or sodas. 

I have a very strong feeling I will be back!
author: Rachel E.

description: The restaurant is located in a very good place. The only issue is parking. I spent like 20 mins just to find a place to park. Maybe, I was looking at the wrong places. Food is very good. We ordered the red curry, stir fry tofu and lemongrass chicken. All dishes were really good. The red curry was very creamy and very unique (to other restaurants I've had). lemograss chicken had that zest of lemograss. Very flavorful. Had a great meal and took a nice towards Lombard St(Crooked St). Only if the staff could keep restaurant a bit more clean. Somehow it was smelling very badly when I visited.
author: Kaul K.

description: Fast service, good portions, and priced right.  However, I have had much better Pad Thai, and so has my friend (he had pork and I had spicy chicken).  We both agree that it was too dry and clumpy, and lacked enough peanut flavor.  But the biggest problem is that we each had TOFU in the dish, seemingly as filler in place of pork and chicken.  Who does this??
author: Matt T.

description: Food is mediocre and the service is awful. We waited 45 minutes for 2 to go entrees and received no apology or attempt to speed up our order.
author: Caity Y.

description:
She who must be obeyed was out for the evening and so I decided to scratch my Thai food itch by trying for the first time ever our local Thai restaurant, Lemongrass Thai Cuisine.

As this was my first outing and my order was simple, I do reserve the right to update this review.

Okay, so I started off with chicken wing appetizers that, for my taste buds, featured a bit too much basil and silver noodles and not enough ground chicken.  These wings were, however, very nicely deep fried.

I ordered chicken red curry and coconut milk with mixed vegetables, and a generous bowl of brown rice on the side.

Overall, the curry wasn't bad and I may return if pressed.

Unfortunately for Lemongrass, I have enjoyed the privilege of supping on many a Thai curry in Thailand, Malaysia and Singapore which, according to Yelp's meticulous guidelines, leaves me no alternative but to agree, "Meh.  I've experienced better."
author: Jay D.

description:
Pretty good thai food - or at least my drunk self thought so. 

 Kathleen W. and I stumbled out from the bar next door - Tonic - after drinking quite a few drinks because of the fundraising done by friends of ours. After drinking like 3 or 4 drinks on an empty stomach, we decided to find a restaurant. We walked outside and right next door was a thai restaurant that looked too nice for us, but the prices were decent, so we decided to eat there. 

I got the pineapple fried rice and KW got the pad thai. I can definitely tell you that they were very good - both dishes. Then again, we were drunk so from what I remember. I'll have to try it again, more sober to really give a better review.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Slow!
Called to get take out. Ordered a simple rice dish. Came after the advised 20 mins and had to wait 15 more.
author: Gerry M.

description: Good pad thai, simple and efficient. No chopstick which was tricky in an hotel room.
author: Louis-C P.

description:
CAN'T GO WRONG WITH THAI FOOD...
(3.75 stars)

Despite the door wide open on a very warm sunny day and flies hovering at the enterance about ready to attack your face, this place was pretty great!!!

- Food, delicious
- Price, decent
- Service, good
- Ambiance, welcoming and quiet

Decided to try a different thai restaurant from the norm. When I'm fixated with a craving, I am on a mission to shut it down. IT WAS SHUT DOWN by the end of my meal - thank you! Since it was my first attempt to try this place, usually I'll order Pad-Thai and judge it on that but since i saw that the wait-staff was Thai, the food must be legit and authentic, no need to put them to the test.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS

GAI PAD KHING ($8.95) - Sliced chicken sauteed with fresh ginger, onion, and dried mushroom. This dish was served family style and had to order rice on the side. Everything was fresh and tasted very good. The ginger was definately fresh, felt like i was just biting into a ginger root. I wished and recommend that they cook down the ginger a little more to give the broth the sweetness of the ginger flavor because every bite was a bit pugnant with raw ginger taste. 

SIDE OF RICE ($?) - It's family style, ordering rice on the side is a must.

Will I be back? Enjoyed the food, service, and quietness of the place. I can see myself coming back but I have my favorite Thai spots already picked out. 

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description: This is only my second time eating Thai food, but this place is great. It is a small little shop and has both a lunch and a dinner menu. We had the prixe fixe menu lunch special that they offered. It started with drinks and then the appetizers. The best of the appetizers was the Thai Sticks. Then there's the soup. Prior to this my one experience with Thai soup was Tom Kha. Here I had the Tom Yum soup,  and it was FANTASTIC!! (I even got a second bowl after our course was over) This was followed by the main course of Pad Thai (kind of sweet and no real spice) that was pretty good. The dessert was a scoop of what I believe to be homemade Ice Cream. I'm not sure what the actual flavor was (it stated Vanilla Bean on the menu) since it had peanuts and what tasted like some caramel drizzle,  but it was so yummy!! If ever I am back in San Francisco,  lunch will be here at least once.
author: George C.

description:
Not the best Thai food you'll ever have, but a solid pick in the area.

The "Lemongrass Chicken Savory" is the real highlight here. It comes out on a sizzling platter, and is certainly savory. For some reason it's sig. cheaper than the other menu items - I hope the meat is actually chicken. 

Their curries are okay. The red and massaman are not super flavorful, green is usually pretty tasty though. 

The Tom Yum and Tom Kha are both good. I like how many mushrooms+shrimp they put in the Tom Yum. 

Usually pretty quiet on weeknights; easy to get a seat.
author: Ryan D.

description:
I have been a regular customer for several years now and never was disappointed. In fact I'll be dining there twice this week!!

Best in Bay is well-deserved.
author: John R.

description:
I've only done take out here and never have dined-in.  Food always arrives hot and fresh.

I think this is one of the better places to get Thai delivery.  I love the egg rolls, seafood salad, seafood combo, and green curry chicken.  

The fried egg rolls are probably my favorite in the city.  They are always crispy and come with a sweet & sour sauce with a little bit of spice.  Filling is also a good mixture of veggies and sliver noodles (vs cabbage and carrots at other places).  The seafood salad is a nice refreshing salad.  Has a nice fresh lime, cilantro dressing with a hint of spice.  A friend once ordered the seafood combo, something I probably wouldn't have ordered.  It was delicious.  It's a nice mixture of seafood with eggplant in a tasty spicy, garlic sauce.  Also, the green curry over rice is always one of my favs.  My friend also said it was the best Thai food they had ever had.
author: Shelly W.

description:
On a slow Monday night 6 of us ordered dinner and each  person was severed separately, the last nearly 30 minutes after the 1st person was served. When we complained the waitress said we were served in the same order that she took our order . The fact that the last person served was 30 minutes later then the first didn't seem to compute .
Also the food was mediocre at best and restaurant itself was freezing -  we all had to wear our jackets.
total bill for six $150.00
author: blaine p.

description:
As our attempt to eat at Aux Delices was thwarted by our failure to first check business hours, my friends decided on Lemongrass, right across the street. And who was I, being an hour late, to say otherwise (even though I had my reservations)? 

After arriving, our party of five got orders of yellow chicken curry, prawn pumpkin curry, chicken pad see ew, and pla-jeaan (fried snapper filets) to share. The yellow curry and pad see ew were okay dishes, but mostly forgettable. The fried snapper was good, albeit a bit on the sweet side due to the tamarind sauce. The pumpkin curry, however, was pretty darn tasty, and on its own, would have earned Lemongrass four stars.

Along with an appetizer and drink that they'd ordered while waiting for me, it came out to be a little under $15 per person after tip. Not bad for a filling lunch, but not a place I'd recommend going out of your way for.
author: Johnny W.

description:
This is a very small restaurant with limited seating so beware if you plan on coming in a large group of 10! Although, the wait was kind of long, I gotta give it up to the waitress that was holdin' down the place all by herself. She waited all tables and was quite punctual. 

On to the food: I ordered the Chicken Pad Thai of course, my favorite thing to order, I don't care if that's boring...I love Pad Thai! It came out kinda slimy, you know the kind of watery versions of Pad Thai and it wasn't as good as I thought it would be, given that this place has a very good average of ratings. My sister ordered the Lemongrass Chicken Savory which was a coconut based, hot garlic sauteed plate. It actually sounded better than it tasted. The Thai Tea was not my cup of tea, tasted processed and not fresh and it was too sweet.

I didn't really get my Thai food fix here! Moving on...
author: Briget P.

description: I had no idea I was a curry fan until I ate here. I am so grateful that my friends introduced me to this place a month ago. The pumpkin curry was soooo good!! The coconut milk soup was also one of my favorites. I can't wait to visit SF again so I can eat at lemongrass!!
author: Liz L.

description: So tasty and consistent.   Dine in, take out or delivery.   Thanks for making our Friday evenings awesome!!!!
author: Chris n.

description: The boneless chicken wing was fantastic! Quick delivery too.
author: Melissa G.

description:
Nice location, staff, very decent portions, quick service, all of that.  But the food is just not flavorful.

I ordered my Pad Woon-Sen with Chicken "spicy", but it had zero taste of any spices whatsoever.  I'm not talking about it not being hot -- there's chili sauces for that.  I mean those magic Thai spice blends that make their cuisine what it is: they were just not there.  I could have just made this at home, and I'm not even Thai!
author: Captain A.

description:
Voted Best of the Bay hmm? Maybe it's "best" if there are no other Thai restaurants and you're reeeaaally hungry and desperately craving Thai food.

The prices are decent for a cheapskate like me...it's just the food is mediocre. Not horrible, but I've definitely had better Thai food. Although I must admit, they know how to cook brown rice! It was soft and fluffy, not crunchy like some brown rice I've had.

APPETIZER: Thai toast. I liked this the best out of all the food we got! It's like a savory deep fried French toast. HMMmmmm!

ENTREES: I got the Pad Makuer Tofu. It was good, but kind of salty. Eggplant = tasty.
Friend got the Yum Noodles (hahaa! Called Silver Noodles Yum). Unfortunately not yum :( Too sour! :P I think they added too much lime juice.
My other friend got the Lemongrass Special Noodles. She had initially wanted the Tom Yum Noodles, but the waitress said she wouldn't like it because it has a distinct smell (??!!!) o.O Uhh...OK?! Could she have suggested it because the special noodles were 55 cents more?? Oh well...the special noodles were pretty good, so I guess that's all that matters right?

The service was OK. Our waitress seemed impatient. I liked the atmosphere of the place (candles, flowers...quite romantic!), BUT I did NOT like the way the seats were set up! There were these triangular pillows separating different tables and you literally have to pick up the pillow to sit down. It was super awkward because we were seated next to these other people and I had to pick up the pillow and maneuver my way in, all the while apologizing to the other party for brushing against their table and basically interrupting their dinner.

I guess if someone wanted to come here, I would go again. I don't think I'd come here of my own free will though. There are better Thai places around, especially in the TL!
author: Kei H.

description:
Geez---not sure what happened to this place--but I ordered a dish with beef---and it was as tough as leather.

Their take out menu states they won an award recently----either they did the ratings themselves or people have just become zombies, devoid of any sense of what IS good food !! I will NEVER drop my money there again.

Pass this one by---its seen its better days .....
author: Chris O.

description: The tom kha soup is DELICIOUS. The pad thai is just okay, it tastes ketchup-based. Good service.
author: Jessica N.

description:
I ordered take out from Lemongrass last night. I got the following:

ITEM: Gra Ga Tiem (Sautéed chicken breast, marinated with garlic, black pepper, mushrooms and yellow onions, served on an iron hot-plate.)
PRICE: $9
REVIEW: The chicken was well marinated but the strips were too thin and 70%+ of the dish was a bed of lettuce. 

Rice was not included, so I had to pay extra (brown rice: $2.50) for it.

The kicker here is that the (mediocre) meal totalled $13 (including tip and tax). I could've gone to Square Meals (for example) a block away and ordered a 5 star meal (e.g., a large portion of well seasoned organic chicken with a delicious nutrient-rich side) of similar size for the same price! I know this for a fact because I ate at Square Meals on Monday.

My point here is this place is outrageously overpriced given some of the alternatives in the immediate vicinity.
author: Ricardo B.

description: Great food, reasonable prices. By far the best Thai place in the surrounding area!
author: Brandon L.

description: Not impressed with the food despite the reviews. I ordered chicken pad see ew. The veggies were undercooked but chicken was over cooked. The first server I encountered with was not friendly, and the second one wasn't much better. The third one finally met my expectations. I guess the third time was indeed the charm.
author: Nancy Y.

description:
Although I'm not typically a big Thai food fan, my wife enjoys it more than I, so we decided to give this little place in our neighborhood a try.  I went in with an open mind, and we had a reasonably priced dinner, but the two of us had mixed results.  I actually enjoyed the meal much more than I expected, and she enjoyed it less.  The culmination of our two experiences at the same meal would be a 3-star rating.

We started with a silver noodle salad, which I enjoyed (it has a degree of zing and spice in the dressing), but my wife did not.  My wife also started with a small bowl of coconut soup with chicken that was probably the high-point of the meal for her (I did not taste it but she consumed the entire portion). My main course was a sauteed swordfish dish on a hot plate with mushrooms and onions paired with brown rice that was absolutely delicious.  My wife ordered a peanut-sauced chicken dish which was just so-so at best.  I think in retrospect we should have ordered a Pad-Thai...

Anyways, while I'd be open to returning (I really enjoyed the swordfish, and had my eyes on several red snapper dishes...), I think we will probably gravitate towards other options.  I have had more consistent experiences at the various Osha Thai locations as well as a nice recent meal at My Ivy on Divisadero St.
author: Andy S.

description:
Food was great and plentiful, service was above average, however the fact the hand soap in the unisex bathroom is watered-down to the point you cant feel soap on your hands when washing, nor smell the scent of soap on your hands after washing, leads me to wonder how fecal-free the food is after the chefs 'wash' their their hands after using the rest room.

Will happily try another of the many Thai places in SF that have soap in the bathroom.
author: dutchy s.

description:
my dad and i have been ordering from here for a few years, every couple of weeks. they have been getting a good amount of money from us for a long time (we order a LOT of food). 

HOWEVER, they will never be getting a penny more from us. Last time we ordered, there was a  STAPLE in one of our dishes. a staple. not a hair or something organic, a SHARP POINTY METAL staple. wtf???

not only that, when we called to complain, they were very unapologetic, it seemed like they didnt even believe us. after like 10 minutes they offered to knock $10 off our bill. 10???? seriously?? 

we will never be ordering from here again.
author: Sarah M.

description: Lemongrass is my go-to neighborhood Thai spot. I've ordered delivery numerous times and have eaten at the restaurant twice to date. It's a quiet little place. My favorites are the spicy seafood noodle soup (big portions of seafood compared to most) and chicken dish with basil.
author: Leah B.

description:
My husband and I were at the tail end of a lovely visit to SF and figured there would be some good Thai here. After reading some reviews of what was walking distance to our hotel we chose Lemongrass. 
It started out well enough. The service was nice and since the restaurant wasn't exactly hopping we were taken care of promptly.
We started with an appetizer of Mieng-Kum which was one of the most interesting and flavorful Thai appetizers I've ever had. I then ordered my usual "let's see how they do it here" green curry with beef, and my husband ordered the red curry with chicken. That's where it went downhill. I lovelovelove a good green curry and this was not the place for it. Though neither dish was bad, neither was that great. We both ordered medium spicy and for what we got we assumed the waitress heard us say "no spice whatsoever". Both dishes offered a ton of meat and veggies, though my biggest complaint was that they used standard eggplant in the green curry rather than the expected Thai eggplant. So what I ended up with was a bunch of mushy, and frankly, disgusting slices of the stuff. That ruined the whole meal for me. 
The red curry was just ok. It had an odd, though not necessarily earthy flavor we couldn't recognize.
We didn't bother with dessert. 
I seriously recommend finding another Thai restaurant if in this area. I'm sure there's at least one and I wish we could've found it. However, if you just want an appetizer, that Mieng-Kum was good enough to make a stop in here on your way to a better Thai main course.
author: Laura P.

description:
The boy ordered takeout for us from Lemongrass twice. We had the pineapple fried rice with brown rice with extra veggies, the pad thai, the chicken delight (chicken breast topped with red curry and peanut sauce with cucumber salad) and tofu basil (crispy tofu, sauteed with lime juice, chilli, green and red bell peppers and basil; served with rice).

I'm a big fan of the fried rice and they really do throw a good amount of veggies in there. The pad thai was pretty run of the mill, good but unspectacular. I tried a piece of the chicken delight and it was flavorful. 

I totally see myself ordering from this place in the future.
author: Alice W.

description: Disaster. Red curry is mooshy beef and tired zucchini. Apparently they don't have a spicy curry.   Very difficult to communicate with the staff.
author: lance j.

description:
clean, affordable and solid thai food. it was nothing out of the ordinary - not the best and nothing to complain about. 

their peanut sauce and pad see ew was really good. other than that we enjoyed the spring rolls, fried rice satay and yellow curry.
author: Mandy A.

description: Perhaps it was the smell of bathroom pervading the joint or the salad , albeit complimentary, that tasted and appeared about a week old and just not edible, that left me with a bad feeling about this place. It gets an extra star cuz the main dish was decent. It is pretty hard  to make spicy green coconut sauce taste bad, however. Everything about this place made me feel they were skimping where ever they could to save a dime. Don't they realize that's just a tail spin mentality and will only drive business away.
author: Matt A.

description: This is one of the best Thai restaurants in the neighborhood. The food and service are very good and it is open for lunch. The prices are very reasonable as well.
author: Linda F.

description: My absolute favorite Thai restaurant in the city. So close to home, great food & cozy atmosphere!
author: Lauren C.

description: The best Thai I've found in the Bay so far; their prices were super reasonable (I went at lunch) and the fried banana dessert with coconut ice cream gives me a Pavlovian response. Unfortunately, it's awfully far from my Oakland home, but when I'm in that part of the city, I'll be sure to go back to Lemongrass. Also refreshing to know that they've occupied the space for many years (20? Maybe?), particularly in an era when businesses turn over so often as a result of high rents.
author: Linnie G.

description: Food was ok, sweet & sour soup was yummy, but my main dish was a bit bland. Service was prompt and friendly.
author: Jenn F.

description:
AMAZING. AUTHENTIC. GREAT SERVICE.

if you're in sf, you need to try this place - if you can handle the perpetual wait to get a table.
author: Jennifer C.

description: A real gem in upper Polk!  I eat there any chance I get.  All dishes are prepared fresh, healthy and delicious.  The owner, Toi, is always on site to make sure all runs smooth.  Great food, atmosphere and service.  A MUST try!
author: jerry t.

description: Today was the second time I went to Lemongrass for lunch and sadly, the last. Last time I ate here, I was disappointed with the food and decided that I should not come back. But I wanted to give this restaurant a second chance and ordered something else this time. I was wholly disappointed once again. I ordered the Lemongrass chicken savory as recommended by yelpers. It was not good. The chicken tasted like it was on its last leg (pun intended). The whole dish was smothered in peanut sauce and I do not like peanut sauce! Yuck! I was feeling sick to my stomach and gagged as I ate until I decided to call it quits.
author: Ni N.

description: We went on monday for lunch. As soon as you enter there is no one seat you. i waited for 5-10 minutes and i walked all the way near to kictchen to ask  to find us seat.  It took 25 mins for her to take an order. I saw only one waiter in entire restaurant where she takes order, seats people, takes out dishes and even pickup spilled food on the floor. The food was oksih, i have tasted lot better then this people. I would not come back. Need more helping hand there.
author: Madhankumaran K.

description: Not the best place to go if you need to eat a gluten free dinner as the servers had a problem understanding what you are trying to tell them about celiac problems.
author: Lance F.

description:
This place was horrible.  It has this smell.  

We had a sauteed beef with onion and basil.  Beef was not tender.  It also doesn't taste like beef at all and the sauce overpowered everything.  

The worst was the BBQ chicken.  It was dry and tough, taste like microwaved reheat.  We then told them about how tough it was.  The waitress said it was their recipe, the dryness was a part of it.  I don't know why anyone would like microwaved dry tough chicken because we just couldn't finish, even though we were starving!  If they like that chicken, I question their palette, and how that translates to other things on their menu.
author: Loretta H.

description:
Food was ok.  Definitely not "Best of the Bay" quality as this restaurant advertises. 

Things ordered:
LEMONGRASS CHICKEN SAVORY - a "Lemongrass favorite".  It was a thick sauce-based dish, with coconut milk, chili, and peppers.  I thought it was too sweet.  It did taste much better two days later as leftovers.

PLA-MUK-KRA-TIEM  - calamari sauteed in garlic and black pepper.  Good.  Very simple nice flavor.

POH-PIER-SOD - an appetizer of a rice paper roll stuffed with tofu, cucumber, snow peas, carrots and topped with sweet and sour tamarind sauce.  I thought the rice paper was thick but soft, perhaps a bit too 'doughy'.  

Service was good.  The interior is on the medium-small side, but out of all the other surrounding restaurants on Polk street, this one had no wait.  My friend and I were able to sit down immediately for a Saturday night dinner.
author: Jeanne L.

description: Ordered a Pad Thai. Very disappointing. It was basically a flat tasting pasta with shrimp. Even with extra shrimp, it had at most 7-8 shrimp. No significant amount of nuts, veggies, or anything that makes a Pad Thai a Pad Thai. Will not order again.
author: Karl V.

description:
The Bottom Line: More expensive Thai food, homely décor, service is mediocre, food is ok.

I went to this place with my parents on a Saturday afternoon. There was one lady serving all the tables, big mistake. Then again you don't expect Asian places to have good service, well this Asian place costs more, so I DO expect it to. Waitress was nice, but couldn't really deliver, service was slow. Food was good, but not anything to rave about, prices were 2-3 dollars more for everything, but quantity was okay.
author: Steven C.

description: Ordered take out from here in a Thursday night. We are vegetarians and had the pad see ew, tofu with ginger, eggplant with tofu, and red curry. While everything was okay, nothing stood out and overall the food was bland and all dishes tasted similar. Next time we'd probably just go with Thai Spice down the road on Polk-- they're a little slower but better.
author: T K.

description:
Heads up.
