Before I moved to San Francisco, I wasn't a Thai aficionado. Yet upon moving to Union/Van Ness, I sampled Lemongrass within my first month here and was hooked. Afraid that I was perhaps being hasty in declaring it my FAVORITE THAI EVER, I decided to look around and test out the competition. Little Thai (often regaled as a fave) failed miserably, especially in the coconut soup (Tom Kha Ghai). Thai Spice, further up the street on Polk, also suffered an embarrassing loss. Every place I tried couldn't meet up to the flavor, price or selection of Lemongrass. They master the "basics" like Pad Thai and take their curries to an enviable level of awesomeness. Poh Pier Sod is a tasty appetizer and, as mentioned above, their coconut chicken (or tofu) soup is definitely the best in the city.

The only downside is that they no longer deliver to my neighborhood (NOPA) but I'm currently concocting creative bribery schemes. Trust me, it's worth it.
author: Aubrey S.

description: It's ok... the pad thai was mediocre for a Thai place in San Francisco. Would eat there again, but wouldn't go out of my way for the food
author: Daisy J.

description:
This place is guuuude.  They have the best pad see ew in the neighborhood; I'll get it with fried tofu and without the broccoli.  The noodles are just perfectly cooked and have the right amount of grease.  The red curry with beef is astounding too.  I get delivery from Lemongrass quite regularly and there has been no incident yet.

I ate there once and the service was pretty friendly and quality.
author: King D M.

description:
My favorite Thai restaurant. Big menu, friendly, not overpriced.

The Tom Yum Gai soup is simply addictive, spicy and sour broth with mushrooms and chicken (no coconut). I even nominated it for 7x7's Top 100 list. 

Their menu is huge, the pad thai isn't too oily and they have good sticky rice with mango.  Thank goodness I live close to Lemongrass!
author: Abbie B.

description:
I live about five blocks away from here and am glad that they deliver. Went here today for lunch and I was craaaving something soupy with noodles. I ordered the Chicken Tom Yum Noodles which had flat noodles in this clear lemongrass flavored broth with tons of ground chicken on top. It was really really yummy and totally hit the spot. I also tried the praram neur (beef and spinach with peanut sauce) which was also good.

But - the reason I have to write is that the waitstaff here is SOO so so SOO accommodating. This crazy lady with a somewhat British accent came in with some other person. She asked for them to close the door because she was sooo cold - well, they were delivering their food, so it was sorta hard to keep the door closed. Then I heard her say that she called ahead of time for Lemongrass to raise their thermostat to a higher temperature! OK - i have NEVER ever heard of this, but thought hmm, that's cool that they were willing to do it....

then she pointed to a light across the room asking the waitress to turn it off because the fluorescent lights "annoyed" her. The waittress already turned the light so it faced the wall but said that she needed to leave it on SO SHE COULD SEE!! I then look up and see that there are barely any lights on and the ceiling lights are on, but dim. My brother and I are cracking up at this point. Since I'm sitting next to this crazy whacked out weirdo, I can't stare...but I see my brother and his expression. Anyway, the point of this is that the food here is good and if you need the room to be warmer or colder or can't stand lights, i'm pretty sure they will accomodate.
author: Natalie S.

description: Every time I walk by Lemongrass it always smells so good, so I was excited to try it. My boyfriend and I ordered take out for lunch. We had the pineapple fried rice and the Shrimp Pad Thai. The portions were definitely hefty. Lots of food for the price! The pineapple fried rice was dry. The shrimp pad thai only had like 3 shrimp and a ton of under cooked tofu. The taste was flavorful, and was spicy with not being too hot (I asked for extra spicy). The only problem with the taste was that I think there was a little too much fish sauce. Overall I would like to go back and try some other dishes. But being new to San Francisco and thoroughly overwhelmed with all the Asian cuisine I'll probably try a couple other Thai restaurants before ordering from the same one twice. I do love my Thai food.
author: Rachel F.

description:
Have I just found a new favorite Thai restaurant? I might have . . . I need to do more sampling of the menu to make a final conclusion.

I had the beef satay, the first satay that was not even a hint dry! Is this even possible? I'm flabbergasted. 

I also had the Tom Kha Gai soup (Chicken with coconut milk, galanga, lemon leaves and lime juice.) and like every asian I threw some rice in there. Quite the treat on this cold day at work! 

They delivered really fast too!

When I eat here again I will sample other items and determine if this will be my new fave!

To be continued . . . .

1/20/08
Okay update. No not the best. Osha is still the best by far. The Pad Thai here is bland. But they do deliver!
author: Christina B.

description: I cater from this restaurant at least once a month and they are always delicious! Whatever you order tastes amazing and they are always on time.
author: Melissa K.

description: Everytime I order pork pad thai take out.  Every time I get chicken.
author: Luke D.

description:
4 stars for restaurant decor, 1 star for food, so that's about 2 stars.
Little Thai on corner of Broadway and Polk is the opposite.  4 stars for food and 1 star for restaurant decor.  

Taste Taste:

Order soup at Lemongrass, then order soup at Little Thai and be SHOCKED at the difference.  Little Thai is so much better.

Same reaction for pad see ew and pad thai.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Just went for lunch with some co-workers.  

+ Empty at 12 on a Tuesday.
- Empty at 12 on a Tuesday.
+ Salad starters for all - free.
- Dressing is the dipping sauce for spring rolls. Syrupy.
+ Tasty, light Tom Kha.
+ Pretty lemons in the ice water.
+ Mango and Sticky Rice.
+ My meal came to $7.00
- Had to go back to work.

I guess the good outweighed the bad.
author: Rachel G.

description:
I've had many dishes in the past and the rating for those would be 3-4 but based on the strength of two dishes that I get every single time now this place is 5 stars. What are they?

1) Pumpkin curry shrimp
2) Chicken savory

Both are off of the specials menu. I have no need for the big green menu any longer :-)
author: Michael K.

description:
I like this place because it is so close to my apartment and really quick for take out, but the food was just okay.  I have only ordered out here but it has been more than easy to do this.  One great thing is that you can order off the internet and it will really be ready at the time you want to pick it up.

I have ordered the pad thai which is pretty good.  The portions are huge, so there was enough for 2 meals, or at least 1 1/2 meals.  I also have had the red curry a couple of times.  It is a bit spicy but nothing too much and that's what made me like it.  Overall, great for takeout, but nothing that I would go out and have dinner at.
author: Cara D.

description: Pumpkin curry with prawns, silver noodle yum (w/ chicken) and steamed mussels.  Round that off with a Thai iced tea and coconut juice and you have quite a nice post Bay to Breakers dinner.  The pumpkin curry made a great lunch on Monday.  I'm no expert on Thai food, but it seems like good food for the price.
author: Corey V.

description: San Francisco is inundated with Thai food. In order for me to get excited about Thai food I have to be seriously wowed. Suffice it to say, Lemongrass did not wow me. However, their lunch deal is pretty sweet and worth a try if you find yourself in the area.
author: Miriam W.

description: They were going to get 5 stars until we left and realized we asked for to-go boxes for our food and never got half full plates of food back. So if you want doggy bags, keep on top of it. Otherwise, the food was good especially the Thai toast, green curry and pineapple rice. The Pad Thai was bland and I've had better elsewhere. Prices are very reasonable and the portions are large.
author: M S.

description:
This place is our go-to for not wanting to cook, wait too long for delivery, or go out.  Delivery is free but we usually pick up. 
Red curry is really good although the chicken is kind of tough. The sauce is delicious. Pad Thai is pretty good except for the itty bitty baby shrimps that come in it. Last night we tried the sweet and sour chicken and i was expecting a battered-type but the chicken was naked and probably about a million calories less. All the food is good for sharing.
author: Jamie G.

description:
I like lots o shrimp in my Basil Shrimp...I think they gave me 4. Four sad lonely shrimp lost in a sea of saucey veggies - do you know how hard it was to cut those shrimp into mini morsels just so they were evenly assigned throughout my meal?  

More shrimp lemongrass...more shrimp.
author: Melissa H.

description: I've been coming here for over ten years. It's consistently good! Great place for date night. Fantastic spring rolls!
author: Aljan U.

description: Had I written this review a month ago, I would have given them three stars. After our latest experience with them, they deserve only ONE! We've eaten at almost every Thai place in the Russian/Nob Hill area-- I'm a Thai food junkie. This was one of our go-tos. However, our latest delivery order was a disaster. We ordered the fresh spring rolls and they were horrible! I've order fresh spring rolls many, many times. They are supposed to be made with rice noodles, served with peanut sauce and usually made with Thai basil or mint. These were made from some sort of crepe-like pancake and were serve with YELLOW MUSTARD!  French's mustard! Horrible. They were inedible. I called them back once we opened them and they were rude and unhelpful. We did laugh about it though...
author: Cheyenne C.

description:
My daughter is a big fan of Thai cuisine and having driven home from college she was jonesing for it. We decided to check someplace new and settled on Lemongrass Thai. Street parking was fine that evening and as we approached the door, the window full of twinkling lights was a perfect introduction on a chilly evening. We walked in and found ourselves in the middle of the dining room. I'm glad we didn't wind up sitting by the door.

We were seated quickly and offered menus. Between what was on the menu and an accompanying sheet of specials, there was far too much to choose from.  The waitress came to take our order. I asked about several items including Chicken Tom Yum Noodles. She assured me I would prefer the Nuer Yang over the noodles. Hmmm. How could she know what I would like (or not like)? I ordered the Nuer Yang and the chicken Larb. 

The Larb soon arrived. The order was large. My daughter being a vegetarian did not partake. (She ordered the Basil Crispy tofu, sauted with limejuice, chili,green and red bell peppers and basil; served with rice.) The Larb was tasty and I finished the order. For my entree I had the Nuer Yang (broiled top sirloin beef, sliced and served with lime juice). The beef was a bit overcooked and felt as if it had been prepared earlier and kept to serve. My daughter enjoyed her Tofu but there was far too much for her to finish.

The food? Good to fair with portions being at least generous to gigantic. Make the portions a bit smaller with a bit more attention to quality. It could be that if I had ordered from the specials menu it would have been fresher/better. The service was quick but perfunctory. The ambiance was strip-mall commodity Thai. There's nothing compelling that would have me return with so many other options. 

2.5 stars.
author: Gary C.

description: Our neighborhood go-to place. Food is always great, friendly staff, cozy atmosphere. Order several dishes to share. Pumpkin curry is my favorite. Their delivery service is prompt and perfect for when you want to eat in.
author: Anne G.

description: Decent place. Food was good but not extraordinary. Still it hit the spot and the service was great.
author: Chati W.

description:
Basically a solid Thai joint in Russian hill.  Dont expect to be wowed.  Havent had a bad dish yet and havent once thought anything was particularly inspiring.  Go if you are in the hood and looking for Thai - but I wouldnt recommend it as a destination.  

For sure better than a kick in the nutz.

sabai sabai
author: Brad C.

description:
They deliver! It's great, cheap, easy and so good. 

Spring rolls, red curry, sweet and sour soup...a yum, yum thai experience right in the comfort of your own home.
author: Kristina A.

description:
I went here with my girlfriend, we are on a quest to find the best Thai food in the city. Let me just say, this is not the best. As a matter of fact, this has been my least favorite of all the Thai place's i've tried here in the city.

I got the usually Pad Thai and Curry, both were below average. The Papaya Salad  was really bad... I couldn't even finish it. 

The service was average at best, esp considering it was a slow Tuesday night with only 3-4 tables on the entire place. 

My theory on Thai restaurants is your either Traditional.....authentic, or fusion. I found Lemongrass to be neither... i didn't remind me of being in Thailand, and it didn't push the envelope with the amount of options for Thai food in the city, I have no reason to go back to Lemongrass.
author: Blake W.

description:
Mmmmmm, easily my favorite Thai restaurant in the city. The servers are attentive and friendly, and the setting is inviting and comfortable (though slightly cramped). 

I generally stick to what I like (I am the girl who orders a 2 egg breakfast at a nice brunch place) and ordering at Lemongrass is no exception. Their pad see ew is amazing, and it's not heavy/oily like it is at many other restaurants (*cough* Osha). Plus it's only $6.95 so you'll still have enough money left to hit up Royal Oak or Shanghai
Kelly's for a drink afterwards. 

It does get a little crowded on the weekends, but I've never waited for more than 15 minutes. It's also a great place to grab takeout. I haven't tried their delivery yet, but one of these days I guarantee I will be that lazy...
author: lindsay w.

description:
Upon reading mixed reviews on the place I am glad to say that I had a great time here. The food was some of the best I've had in SF as far as curries go. The Beef Red Curry was by and large the crowd favorite. It had just the right amount of spice and richness that balances a truly amazing curry dish. 

I was not a fan of  the Beef Larb- it was a bit too "piquant" as one of my dining companions termed it.  The Pork Pad See Eiw and the chicken pad Thai were tasty and not too dry. They packed flavor and created the right texture which was divine. 

Service is also very attentive. Ohh La La
author: Stacy T.

description: Food was OK, but the delivery was terrible. It went from a 45 minute delivery to a two hour one, and every time I called the restaurant, they were rude and basically kept telling me "10 more minutes" until an hour had passed. They clearly didn't care whether I got my food on time or not. Awful customer service.
author: Omar A.

description:
Jsut came back from lunch. My boyfriend has the lunch combo plate, eggrolls and red beef curry. I had the lunch combo with Chicken Satay and yellow chicken curry.

Pros- The red beef curry was fantastic, I wish I ordered it. Food came out fast.
Cons- The satay was cold. The yellow curry  was good, but the chicken in it was not. It was all dark meat with some skin and bones still on it. I know I sound picky, but I'm not a fan of picking off the bones. Next time I'll stick with the beef. 
Overall a quick and easy spot for a sit down lunch.
author: Kelly P.

description:
The food here is so good!!  I am giving it 5 stars because I like it more than Little Thai at Polk and Broadway...and I'd still give Little Thai 4. 

Anyway, the Pad Thai is awesome, and I really love the basil eggplant and tofu.  It's very reasonably priced, and the ambiance is great .  Also, if you want to order out or for delivery, you can view their whole menu and order online.
author: Carolyn H.

description: Randomly found this place on open table.  Made a reservation for 3 an hour or two before we wanted to eat.  Quick walk from the house with no expectations.  We ordered Tom Gum Kung soup, some yellow curry and pad thai.  Since my friend had just done the Tim Lincecum (3 double doubles, 2 fries and a shake) this was enough food for 3 of us.  I'd say it was all pretty good.  No complaints but it didn't tantalize my senses making me want to rave about this place.  Good local casual restaurant for a lazy weeknight meal.
author: Jonathan L.

description: I really, really wanted to like Lemongrass. It was in my neighborhood, inviting, had good service.... the food is simply unimpressive and plain. Maybe I've just had exceptional thai food too many times!
author: Robynne W.

description: The food is good but somehow I didn't eat here for years and didn't miss it. It doesn't have much flair and the waiters were never special but always slow. I liked their TOM YUM GAI & PAK once in a while but there are too many great new restaurants for me in San Francisco to come back here more than once a year.
author: Patrick E.

description: Cheap great Thai food. They deliver too. Its a little cold when you sit next to the door sometimes.
author: J M.

description: My friend took me here, noting it's popularity, and giving me high expectations.  If it weren't for the fact that we sat without service for close to half an hour, I'd give a better rating. The food was good, not the best Thai I've ever had, but there were a couple notable dishes: the eggplant with prawns and scallops, and the pad see ew.  Both were excellent, the rest was fairly average...deliciously average.  Would I go again?  Absolutely.  There was a 100 item menu that we sampled maybe seven of, which can often be the overwhelming part of ordering Thai, but to me it's exciting to have so many savory dishes, each with a uniqueness all it's own.
author: Andy O.

description:
One of my top2 favorite Thai places to eat (the other being Osha).  Usually never lines here and they are really nice.  Love their curries, so tasty.  Parking could be difficult in this area though so give it time.
Nice place to walk around after a meal.
author: Mitch A.

description:
SERVICE = Up to par.  There's one waitress I like better than the rest.  She's somewhat more friendly and isn't pushy or in a rush.  

FOOD = Yummy.  This restaurant has Pad Thai that I like--I get it with pork.

DESSERT = Sweeeet!  I really like the fried banana and ice cream :)

PAYMENT/PRICING = Fine.. Cast/Debit/Credit.  I think pricing is good.  It's not over-the-top.  Pineapple fried rice seems over-priced, but you get a sizable helping.

PARKING = Ehh... street parking.  Good luck!  Or there's Valet.

*EXPERIENCE* = * Memorable*  My fiance lives up the street, but we only started eating here a few months ago.  We just thought, "Why haven't we eaten here before?"  I think it's worth the money.  We like to eat at Lemongrass and then pop in to Loving Cup right next door.  I also took 4 of my girlfriends to Lemongrass and they were all pleased with the experience and the food--our total came out to not even $30!!  We shared so when we split the bill, we each paid $8 :)
author: Doreen M.

description:
This place is no good.  Really, I got to go last night and it took almost 40 minutes for them to make out order (they told us 20).  They were also rude to me while I was waiting.

To make things worse, we got home and the food was only mediocre.  The tom yum (sweet and sour soup) only had limp cabbage and carrot discs in it.  The curry tasted like water - I had to dump soy sauce all over it to give it flavor.
author: Reggie G.

description: I don't know about other items on the menu, but my pad Thai was pretty bad. The sauce tasted like ketchup.
author: Robert C.

description:
Does anyone notice that it smells like "feet" in there? I almost gagged at the odor when I first ate there. Either it's coming form the carpet or the incense but regardless, I think I'll order take out or delivery from now on...

I really liked their stuffed fried chicken appetizer, but it was REALLY greasy.
author: Mashimaro M.

description:
I am going to give this 4 stars because everything my sister and I ate tonight was freaking delicious: 

- thai stick; a delicious deep fried shrimp/chicken thing, damn tasty
- crispy tofu: best crispy tofu I've ever had.  Most of the time, tofu comes out soggy and mushy. But not this crispy tofu. Super crispy and delicious!
- basil tofu: sauteed soft tofu, uber delicious as well.  

Neither dish was spicy, but I didn't care. They were goooood. 

I'll definitely come here again.
author: Joanne D.

description:
This place offers the best Thai Food that I've had in this city--maybe Ploy II in upper Haight can rival, but that's about all I've discovered so far.  It took me 2 and 1/2 years to even find some place that I could stand.

I'm a thai food snob.  I put myself through college working at a thai restaurant--even worked up my tolerance for spice to compete with the dudes in the kitchen by the time I was graduating--so I take my thai food very seriously.

The food here is authentic and reasonably priced and they DELIVER.  What more could you ask for?  The menu is vast--ranging from their safer dishes for those unaccostomed to thai food and its wonderful flavors (I still love a good pad thai, too) to those that only the true lover of thai food would order.  

They make a killer green papaya salad and their curries are smooth and spicey--no matter which one you get (you know how green curry can get clumpy sometimes, well they do it well).  And mango sticky rice!! It's SO good it'll change your perception of rice forever.

I have to admit that I've never actually eaten in the restaurant, because I'm a sucker for free delivery.  But I've picked up an order once and the atmosphere was really nice and calming.  Given that they 're fast as whips with delivery, I can't imagine that their service is poor, but I guess you'll have to go find out!
author: Justine H.

description:
Hey, I'm not gonna lie, this thai food did not knock me on my feet. But it's a good standard Thai place if you are in the hood. 

I will say the service was good and the peeps nice.
author: Jacqueline M.

description: This has been my favorite SF Thai place since the early '90s when it first opened on Van Ness (prior to moving to Polk St.). The reason: excellent service, tasty, fresh food, and of course BEST peanut sauce EVER. And Thai Toast. ALWAYS love the Thai Toast appetizer.
author: Diane C.

description: Fantastic Thai food!! Welcoming atmosphere and very tasty meals. Curries are delicious and creamy, and they have great lunch special deals. Will definitely come back next time we're in town!
author: Helene B.

description: Best Thai I have had in the city for the price by far. Go to Osha if you want to pay $14 for Pad Thai, go to Lemongrass if you want chicken Pad Thai and three delicious egg rolls for $14. I prefer more food for my money and loaded with flavor too.
author: Claudia F.

description:
I went here last Saturday with a group of friends for dinner. There were six of us in the party and I called on Thursday to make a reservation and got one with no problem. However, when we arrived, the table was there, but not all of the chairs. It took them about 10 minutes to assemble 5 of the 6 chairs. One of the guys had to stand for another 5 minutes waiting for a chair. 

The service was....interesting. We had three different waitresses come over to take our orders and when the food came out, it came out one dish at a time. By the time everyone had their food, the first few dishes were cold. 

The only redeeming part of the meal was that the food was pretty tasty. I would recommend doing take out there instead of going there to eat.
author: Jenn G.

description:
They can actually FIND my place in the fort which is a huge bonus.

It's not that cheap - for 20 bucks I get pad thai and a large container of soup - but it's fast, reliable, and so good.

The leftovers are just as good the next morning!

Minus one star for not letting me order a smaller thing of soup.
author: Lauren V.

description:
I concur on the poor delivery-thing. They don't advertise it, but there's a minimum buy-in of $12 for delivery. It may not seem like much, but it's a shocker when you only planned to purchase one dish. The person on the phone isn't that great (lots of background noise, terse questions) but my order came out correctly and within the 45 minutes they told me. There's an online order form as well but I question how often someone checks that. 

Otherwise, the food is solid. Tasty stand-bys like red curry and pad thai at affordable prices. It's definitely a better place to visit in person because the restaurant is cozy and comfortable.
author: Madeline N.

description:
I've taken out the usual suspects: chicken satay, pad see ewe, etc. here a few times since I moved back to the neighborhood and each time, I have been pleased.  I also participated in a company event several years ago that ended with a buffet meal here that was excellent.

What I love: lots of fresh veggies and large prawns

The only I didn't like was my eggplant with tofu dish - very tasty, but sitting in oil. I know, that is the rule, apparently, for eggplant - must sit in oil.

Overall, it's been solid. Service is nice, too!
author: Melissa G.

description:
Pretty decent Thai food.  Friendly service, comfortable atmosphere, tasty food.  Unfortunately not the most generous portions.  
I highly recommend the snapper.  Great for a fast sit-down meal or takeout.
author: Anna R.

description: Average Thai food in Russian hill.  If going for Asian style, the Vietnamese place across the street is a much better.
author: Matthew F.

description: Solid place for take out if you're in the hood and hungry. I've tried pad Thai, Thai beef, Thai fried rice, pad see ew. All are tasty and you can split the portion up into 2-3 meals. Option for brown rice. Quickly made.  "A" in my book!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Adorable, cozy little place that we went to right after we went to Aux Delices and found that they were closed for lunch on Saturdays (?!).

The food was hearty and delicious, although it was totally devoid of spiciness.  Apparently you have to ask if you want it spicy?  That's a new one for me, but whatever.  Anyway, it was still really good, despite that.

We cleaned our plates and the nice waitress was genuinely impressed by that feat.  :)
author: Heather T.

description: One of the best thai restaurants I've ever been to. I had the seafood plate and it was...omg amazing!
author: Adeel Y.

description:
I would actually give this 1/2 of one star but I couldn't figure out how to do that here.
This was probably the worst food and service experience I've had in San Francisco over the past five years.  To give them benefit of the doubt we were a large party but they accomadated us so they should have been ready for us.  We asked for some wine or ice buckets for the champagne and sparkling wine we brought and we were given a bucket with eight to ten pieces of ice in it.  THen when asked for more ice they filled it to the top so we couldn't hardly put the bottle in.  Do these people know how to chill a bottle of wine?  All of the food tasted like it was made in the morning and heated up for us.  The soup wasn't hot, it was full of sugar and hardly edible unless you like sweet soup.  The fried appetizers were somewhat warm but definitely just fresly fried.  Fresh didn't exist in anything we ate.  Perhaps the fried banana was fresh before it was covered in heavy batter then fried.  

Its hard to believe anyone even does take out from this place.  Run don't walk from the entrance.  Don't eat here.
author: Paul B.

description: I love Thai, but typically the quality corresponds to the price.  Not here!  For less than $9, I got a great meal that was high quality, tasty, fresh, and filling.  I don't recommend getting wine with your meal, but the food is excellent, the atmosphere is great for a casual date or going out with friends, and the price (especially in Russian Hill) couldn't be better.
author: Lindsay M.

description: Priced reasonably but not cheap.  The food was mediocre.  The curries were ok although a bit bland.  The noodles where alright but bland as well.  The papaya salad was not authentic, very Americanized.  I would not go far to come here.
author: Josh H.

description:
This place sucks don't go. 

This place is by far the worst thai food I've ever had.
author: Monica F.

description: This is my favourite Thai restaurant in the Marina/ Russian Hill neighbourhood. The food is always great, with lots of veggie, fish and meat options. Their curries are flavorful, and vary in how spicy they are. Their grilled fish entrees and soups are always tasty too. The special list is long, although it doesn't change too frequently but I always order from it! The food is great quality, for a decent price ( mid price range!).  The service is great, the waitresses are always quick to take orders and deliver food and are courteous, and they always welcome you with a smile. This place is always bustling with people whatever day of the week, except I have never had to wait for a table because the service is quick so people are in and out. My favourite dishes are the prawn pumpkin curry and the tofu basil! They even do takeout and delivery!
author: Melissa S.

description:
Lemon grass is ok - definitely not the best Thai food I've had. 

Although the appetisers were quite good, my main meal  was incredibly  average, in fact it was below average. The tofu smelt a bit funky and the sauce was extremely watery,  overall the whole dish was bland, bland, bland - finally had to spoon some of partner's curry over my  tofu to give it some sort of flavour . It's  a good thing I'm resourceful.

Might go back to give it another go - my partner and his mate seemed to enjoy it, so I'm thinking maybe I just ordered the wrong dish.

The service was really good, staff were attentive and the food was brought out quickly and was it was served to us hot - always a plus in my book.
author: Tra-La-La P.

description:
I didn't see anyone mentioning the crispy rice salad, which is my FAVORITE thing here....shredded cabbage, lettuce, green onions, cilantro , with CRISPY RICE balls, in a fish sauce dressing.  Delicious and light.

This is also a good place to take your parents, its clean and cute and very reasonably priced.  Sometimes crowded and loud though, so go at a weird time of day so you can have some room.
author: Flemm F.

description:
If you love the bulk of your meal consisting of onions and bean sprouts, then by all means, go to Lemongrass.  At the good end of the spectrum, the food reminds me of the thai I made in college (at 49cents a lb for onions, you could really make a big meal for cheap!), and on the bad end, it's completely inedible (I had some green curry with beef that I couldn't even eat).

Seriously, the food here is poor to mediocre.  If you want good thai food, go down the street to little thai.  If you want good decor, and don't give a damn about quality food, then go to lemongrass.

I've ordered take-out here 5 times, and only because it's half a block from my house.  Every time, I'm very disappointed.  I really need to learn my lesson.
author: Spencer M.

description:
The food here is always great and the prices are reasonable. Pad Thai, Vegetable Red Curry, and Pad Spinach are great.

Beware, don't sit by the neon sign. It buzzes incessantly.
author: Stu M.

description:
Fantastic green curry.  Fresh noodles.  Nice people.

The ambiance is relaxing, dark and nice.  It's upscale; not a divey Thai joint.
author: Scott W.

description: I'm going to make this short and sweet. This is a beautiful little restaurant. The atmosphere is charming with great lighting, the service is attentive and the food is not only delicious but well-presented. The prices are very reasonable as well. As for the parking...well...it's Polk Street so that's all I can say.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to enjoy a Thai meal in pleasant, comfortable surroundings.
author: Rabbit B.

description: Decent Thai food and nice ambiance-  but I prefer Little Thai just a few blocks up Polk.
author: Jason T.

description: Great place in this part of the city. Anyways, I ordered their lemongrass with chicken and coconut sauce on their special menu again and it was fantastic. Charming atmosphere, they also have a fish tank. I would consider their Thai food to be authentic and the service to be decent overall. Don't plan on parking here if you can avoid the hassle.
author: Brandon H.

description: Had lunch here on Friday and really enjoyed it.  I had the red curry vegetables, which was quite delicious.  Prices are very reasonable.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Delivery: 4 stars/Good - they delivered within the time they promised (35-45 minutes), and on a rainy night, I was impressed. 

Food: 3 stars/OK - spicy Thai basil with chicken was good - nothing amazing, but good. The shrimp pad thai was not good in my opinion, because I could taste the ketchup! Yuck.
author: Shannon W.

description:
Definitely the most consistent and reasonably priced Thai restaurant in the city.  Love the owner, the food is great, easy to get in, quick service...just flat out good.

Check 'em out.
author: Jared P.

description:
Generally: Enh.  Okay.

And occasionally: I want their green curry now.  Mmmm.

And occasionally: Ugh.  Let's just go down to Thai House Express and get something more legit.

Yet I come back here, time and time again.  Is it laziness, the fact that it's only two blocks away and right smack dab on my walk home?  Well, yes, I'm sure that has something to do with it.  But this place also does a lot of things right.  Their crispy rice salad is unusual: limey, cilantro-y, crispy-rice y, I recommend-y.  And the aforementioned green curry is pretty much my staple. They have this yummy way of doing the eggplant in it, and I'm usually not an eggplant lover.  The soups are decent.  

In sum, I'm never wowed by this place, but I'm also not disappointed too much either. And that's saying something!   And the ladies inside are nice.  And they're open, like, all the time.  Big bonus.
author: Ashley S.

description:
What luck to find another great Thai place near my home.  and they deliver!  From the moment we walked in we were welcomed -- just as the sign says and I love the cozy atmosphere of the place.  

The owner, Toi, was on the floor and we were able to talk with her for a bit  (always helps that A. knows a lot of people). She sent us a free app of Thai toast - yummy! and we also ordered the Mieng-Kum -- at first, I wasn't sure I liked it but in the end the crunchy textures and the ginger sauce one me over.  The wait staff is super attentive and I never had to ask for a beverage refill.   Our entree didn't have that many prawns in it and I ordered a chicken satay.  So tender!  

It's a great bargain too, can't wait to take Adam here.
author: Debster C.

description: Good Thai food. Particularly the soups. I find the food not as fatty as other Thai places. Overall we had a good experience here
author: jan w.

description: This place has possibly the worst pad thai of any thai restaurant I've been to.  We ordered shrimp pad thai and aside from the fact that they only put three shrimp in the entire thing, the noodles tasted like they came from a box that I cooked at home.
author: Kay R.

description: Really good food in a fun area. Good service. Fun people-watching. GREAT peanut sauce (my favorite part).
author: Annie A.

description:
Don't listen to the negative reviews if you have not tried this yet.
I love them. I get food delivered and eat there often. It is the perfect fit for me when it comes to thai food. Not to spicy (unless you want that). 
I always order their curry dishes. I love the creamy blend of coconut milk and curry. It is fresh and oh so yummy. My favorite thai place in SF.
It is not costly. Nice and cozy.... My boyfriend can take me there on both valentines and my birthday. The staff are consistantly nice so I know that when I go there I will never have to worry about dealing with bad costumer service. I therefore feel safe bringing friends and family visiting me there.  Five nice star for a very nice, fresh and cozy resturant.
author: Chris O.

description:
A Thai restaurant on the good side of the tracks (North of California).

Had dinner here with friends and found the food to be hit-or-miss.  Staples such as pad thai and the combination spicy seafood (my fav and the dish by which I gauge tasty Thai food) were good but other lesser known dishes (pineapple pork) were too sweet.  They generally cater to an international palate.

On a Sunday night, this place was packed.  Half of the crowd tends to be young couples, the other half are groups of friends sharing a meal.  The decor is a mish-mosh of Thai trinkets but comfortable enough given the cheap prices. 

This is a great casual Thai restaurant to grab some food at but don't expect anything spectacular in terms of food or decor.
author: Jenny K.

description: Cheap thai food! My SF friend took me here for lunch and it was tasty. We ordered crispy rice salad, tom yum gai, nuer tod plik tai, and pad see-ew.  My favorite was the rice salad, right amount of dressing with veggies and crispy rice, very refreshing and light. The soup and the beef dish wasn't as memorable. The pad see-ew confused me because they put cabbage in it, I wish they could put more broccoli in it, or maybe even chinese broccoli, but it still tasted good! I do have to give props to the waitress girl working the restaurant by herself. She was busy, taking orders, bringing out food, filling waters for every customer. My water glass was never empty. I'm impressed!
author: Stella C.

description: The pineapple fried rice and sizzling chicken were fantastic. Service wasn't great, but all in all it was an enjoyable experience.
author: Mike V.

description: This is one of the few thai places on Polk so we were hungry and went.  They charge $2.50 for brown rice!  The spicy beef plate (#43?) was good and spicy.  Good local place for a change in flavors when you get sick of Nick's tacos or Pizza next door but i've had much more awesome thai in San Jose. wonder how the thai place on the corner of B'way and Polk is!
author: Emm C.

description:
This has become our go-to place for Thai. The food and prices are excellent. I am taking one star off for one thing that really bugs me, though: they charge $2.50 per person for brown rice, then bring out a communal pot. When I got the remainder of my food to go, I was presented with a tiny, not-even-close-to-full box of rice--far less than what was left in the pot that I paid $5 for.

Service can be really swift, but occasionally is not so fast at all. It really varies.
author: Jennifer W.

description: I felt like Thai for lunch on Saturday and decided to give this place a try.  Very boring and bland bastardized Thai food at this place.  It's a waste of calories.  I wouldn't bother.
author: Paul K.

description:
i've had a lot of good thai food in the bay area, but this place is really something else.  they have all the familiar favorites, but they all have some small, unexpected delightful twist.

we got the green curry with beef, which they added a bit of sugar to.  it wasn't too much sugar to make the dish sweet, but just enough to enhance the coconut milk's rich and creamy texture.  the pad see ew also had a bit of sugar added to it, so it was sweet and spicy - how very different!  they also had fried softshell crab that came with a sweet, spicy sauce and a garlic chili sauce.  wow, the crab was so tender and juicy, and they were pretty big for softshell crab, too!

the tom yum gai was flavorful, full of vegetables, and came nice and piping hot.  it was so tastey, that i rushed to eat it and burned my tongue a couple of times.  the gai gra tiem (chicken marnated with garlic and pepper served on a hot plate) was freaking amazing.  i'm not even particularly fond of chicken, but i was helping myself to seconds of this dish.  it was so tender and well seasoned.  the gai kraprow (basil chicken) was also another great dish.  we ordered about 6 different dishes, and were not let down by a single one.
author: Angie L.

description: We have been here a few times and always have a good experience. The food is a great deal for the price- large portions. The Tom kha gai is delicious, but I will be sure to ask for more spice/kick next time. The employees and quiet but friendly.
author: Melinda Q.

description: Order the veggie egg rolls.  They're great.  My boyfriend had pepper shrimp and it was just OK.  I had yellow curry which was tasty.  Slow service, but food was overall good.
author: Dawn S.

description:
Decent place, and although they all wear traditional clothing, I'm pretty sure not a single Thai person actually works here.  Everyone looked to be Chinese or Korean, but certainly not Thai. 

Food was good, but nothing I'd go back for.  However, the chicken satay was surprising tender and delicious!  Probably, the best I've had in the city.  The rest of the food was pretty average. 

2.5 stars for an average "eghh" experience
author: ahh lee n a.

description:
This is the one thai restaurant I'll order delivery from.  I've never actually eaten inside, but it does look pretty nice from the pictures and everytime I walk by it seems pleasant.  Enough about that jabber.  I highly recommend their Tom Yum Pak.  I always, ALWAYS order this soup.  Spicy broth (but then again I'm very sensitive to spice), this soup is cooked with cabbage, carrots, lemongrass, and tofu.  It puts the 'Yum' in Tom Yum Pak!  Also good are the veggie spring rolls.  Not the best I've ever had, but they do the trick.  

The sweet & sour chicken is great.  Not only was it (to my surprise) not deep-fried/breaded, but it was like perfectly sauteed.  It was a pleasant surprise to eat it and not feel like I'd just clogged my arteries.  Otherwise, my main staple is the pad thai with shrimp.  Always a good solid order.

Fast delivery, too!
author: Olivia S.

description:
Delicious Thai dishes for a great price - a cozy, reliable place to go for Asian cuisine. I prefer Lemongrass to the Vietnamese place across the street on Polk. The space itself is a little more cramped but the servers are very attentive. Great options for vegetarians but also plenty of meat dishes to choose from. I highly recommend the appetizer sampler - gives you a whole selection of unique tastes to savor!

Perfect place to go in smaller groups. It's got a sufficient wine list and also serves beer but not the place to go if you're feel rowdy. Just a warm, friendly environment with very satisfying Thai food.
author: Ingrid L.

description: My husband and I moved to San Francisco from Virginia about 9 months ago.  We discovered this Thai restaurant during our first couple of weeks in the city and we seriously went here multiple times per week for quite a while.  We still go or order delivery from them at least a few times a month, it is our go-to place.  We don't even want to try another one, this place is that good.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.  The food is consistently amazing.  Also wonderful that they will deliver.  Our favorites are the Lemongrass Chicken Savory and the Tom Yum Noodle soup.  Highly recommend this place!
author: Kelly M.

description: A pretty place, romantic too.   Delicious soups and satay chicken.   Good Pad Thai.  Delicious chicken with basil.   Great location.   Friendly service.  Comfortable seating.  Overall a nice, affordable Thai spot!
author: Henry H.

description: Great Polk street restuarant! I love the veggie egg rolls, the papaya salad, and the green curry. I've converted all my neighborhood friends into Lemongrass lovers too!
author: Alexa W.

description: Bless you for your incredibly unique Thai Toast appetizer and yummy Tom Kha Gai soup -- both of which SO hit my hangover spot on Sunday afternoon. And the fact that you brought it all to my front door makes me love you even more (since I was too toxic to barely move). Neely O'Hara was wrong ... you really shouldn't mix liquor with those pills, but thank goodness there was a Lemongrass light at the end of the tunnel. Sigh.
author: Gregor G.

description: They have some good dishes. I'm almost a regular at this place, and it's a great place to bring a date/ significant other. The tamarind soup is very good--try it!
author: Epicurean _.

description: This place is a bad value for the money.  I got delivery and was shocked to see that the $8 appetizer I had ordered consisted of just 2 chicken wings.  $8 for 2 wings?  I could have ordered a whole chicken for that dough.  The main event, the curry dish, was also very small-- literally half the size of Ratcha Thai Curry in the area, and certainly no more flavorful.  For the same money, a much better value at Ratcha Thai and every bit as tasty.
author: Adam j.

description: Good Red Curry and their shrimp was very good also.  I wish you got a few more shrimp but the quality was solid.  Big fan of this place for Thai food.
author: Harry E.

description: Best Pad See Ew I have ever eaten.  Excellent service, very reasonable prices, outstanding food.
author: Dee K.

description: Right next to where I work, this place is fabulous! The people are nice, the atmosphere cozy...although I often do takeout. The curries are the best thing here, and the spring rolls (fried). Don't bother with the pad thai. The soups are yum yum too though. mm mmm
author: Kyla L.

description: What a cute little restaurant!  I tried the eggplant tofu - trust me non-egglplant eaters - you gotta try this!  Has such an amazing taste combined with brown rice.  The papaya salad and soups with lemongrass have a great tart taste to them.  Love how the prices aren't too scary!
author: Ramoners D.

description: Sorry to be a hater, but this is really some of the crappiest Thai food I've ever eaten. Bland flavors, weird textures, ultra small portions, and totally overpriced. The tofu satay "special" was rubbery with only a miniscule amount of peanut sauce to dip into, and the red curry with beef was edible but far from exciting. They also don't give you a spoon unless you ask for one, which is a glaring sign of inauthenticity.
author: Brent F.

description: Visiting the city and Lemongrass was close to the hotel.  Toi, the owner, actually waited on our table.  Great service and even better food.  The place was slammed and we still got our food in about 10 minutes.  This will be a place I go again when I'm in the city.  Best Thai food I've had in a long time.  Thanks for a great night Toi.
author: Tom W.

description: Not entirely impressed.  Service and food were ok, though not impressed to be served my green curry with long hairs in it.
author: Danae R.

description:
not too shabby. 

unfortunately for this thai place, i had just had thai house express not too long ago and that place kind of beats this one out by a landslide.
however, i will definitely be coming back here considering that it takes me about 30 seconds to walk and the prices aren't that bad. however, i did like the thai iced tea here better than the one at thai house. 

service was fast and friendly.
author: Michelle K.

description: I feel like I am the only person in SF who hates this place. I have given it 2 chances, 1st time everything was floating in grease, the 2nd time everything was so bland and boring. Back to square one on thai takeout.
author: Nicole S.

description: Love Thai food, and this is it! Great tasting and great quality food.  My friends ordered an eggplant tofu dish...I have never liked eggplant, but ended up being one of my favorites that night :)  The service was really good, even though we were late for our reservations on a Saturday night.  I can't wait to go back and try all the dishes on the menu
author: Angela T.

description:
this place is not bad. 

all the food tastes kind of sweet, i had the kee mao with shrimp.  

weirdass semi-bathroom in the back.

place looked clean and nice decor.

i wont be coming back but you can.
author: Jonathan W.

description: I am only reviewing the Tom Yum soup here because it's what I always order these days.  I won't order this particular dish from Lemongrass again.  The soup was completely overpowered by the sour flavor.  There was no subtlety to it at all.  It was just really sour.  If you're looking for good Tom Yum, I highly recommend Bangkok Best.
author: Shu W.

description: This is easy to like.  Lots of delicious Thai, full flavoured and well cooked in.  What can go wrong?  Well, sometimes the vegetables can be undercooked to the point of raw - like crunchy potatoes in the yellow curry.  Hmm.  But undercooked vegetables seem like the fashion in California - maybe Lemongrass is simply cooking with the trend.  Anyway, it's easy enough to order around it.  The portion size is on the large size, so one course is usually enough.  Eat here a lot, and it's often busy, so despite the caveats, they're doing something right.
author: Nick J.

description: My new favorite Thai place in the city. Some Thai places can be really hit or miss for me and this one was a big hit. The restaurant wasn't crowded and the service was very cordial and attentive. The food was fantastic and damn near perfect. Great yellow curry, excellent pad thai and a fantastic savory chicken special. I don't like tofu and even that tasted good. My only complaint, and it didn't take away from the experience at all, was they didn't seem to give us a whole lot of rice. Oh well, who needs to fill up on rice when the food is so delicious?
author: Michael E.

description: Family owned Thai restaurant, with the option of getting it delivered (and they do it quick). Nice on a rainy day in the office. The food is great, and the owners are very appreciative of your business.
author: Jewel N.

description: Chicken pad thai was nasty, but the crispy tofu dishes were great.  I would come back only for crispy tofu since I thought the chicken quality was weird (its white meat but super chewy/not enjoyable texture).
author: Ali G.

description: I've visited this place many times for multiple reasons. The food is always good and consistent. Anytime I have someone in town, I will take them here and they love it. The people are always nice and the seats are really cool with those weird triangle separators for the bench seating
author: Devon M.

description:
Some of the best Thai food I've had in SF. I tend to measure whether or not I like a Thai place based on the Pad Thai noodles and the Tom Yung Goon soup. Both are outstanding here. The veggie spring rolls are awesome too.

Service is good but not great. The place is somewhat small and can get fairly busy on the weekends. Definitely a go-to place if you are in the neighborhood on a week night.. 

Also, big kudos for their delivery service. The arrives quickly and is piping hot. No annoyin goopy delivery bags cause the sweet and sour sauce leaked all over everything.

Me Eat Here Lots.
author: Paddy T.

description: WHOA!  Just realized that I have not reviewed Lemongrass in all my three years of living in Russian Hill AND as the "Mayorette" of Polk St.  Anyway, let's get to it.  Lemongrass is super tastey and get this, there's no "mystery meat" involved.  You know what you're eating. Go figure!  Excellent chicken and noodle dishes and reasonably priced.
author: Danielle V.

description: My favorite Thai place.  Try the basil tofu appetizer!
author: Monika M.

description: We had an event of about 150 people and Lemongrass Thai Cuisine made everyone's night. It was such delicious food I know people were going back for second and third helpings!
author: Kayla B.

description: This place was good, but I wouldn't call it spectacular. The problem with Thai food is that its popularity has caused a huge amount of Thai places to open up, and most of the are pretty average. No quality would bring me back to this particular Thai place again. The service was ok, and the food was fine to eat, and made decent left-overs the next day. A good choice if your in the area, but no reason to go out of your way to explore.
author: Susanne M.

description: There is so much thai food out here that I cant even see straight.   So whenver I try a new place I'm not all that excited and its always pretty much the same.  I still love osha out here the most but this one was pretty tasty.  I only got take out here but I was pretty surprised at how fresh everything came.  The coconut soup was REALLY good and I'm not a huge fan of coconut either.  Id get take out here again but whenever I go out I stay away from Thai.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Not bad.  I went in and ordered a house salad.  I got a huge salad with peanuts.  It was slightly too wet and there was a little water on the plate when I was done with my salad.  Otherwise, good.
author: Joanna S.

description: Yes, it's hard to communicate with the lady on the phone when you order stuff for delivery. But once your past that it's a good experience. Can't remember another place where I've had a better red curry. In fact, portions are too much for just one meal but I always finish my curry. Always. Just can't stop eating it. Had it last night and want more now.
author: Heiko L.

description: I have done take out from here before but never dined in until the other night.  They weren't very busy but the one server they had on was running around like she has just smoked a hubba.  She was put out when I could remember what I wanted and had to reopen my menu (which took two seconds).  Then when we got our food, it took forever for them to clear our table and bring a check.
author: Joseph A.

description: The restaurant was great, service was great, food was good, time spent looking for parking killed it.
author: meL Z.

description: we come here for lunch, and you can get seated right away, the food is consistent,  we get pad-thai noodle with tofu and chicken curry most of the time and they never let me down. The service is always attentive and they remember regular. THANK YOU
author: Giu G.

description: First thing I had here was the pad thai which I wasn't a huge fan of but everything I've tried since (I've only done take-out) has been mouthwatering. I recommend the yellow curry with rice and the chicken pad see-ew. Prices are very reasonable and the portions are humongous- can definitely split one dish among two people.
author: Lauren A.

description: I just moved to the area and was hoping to find my local Thai take-out, unfortunately this will not be the place.  I am a huge basic pad thai fan and unfortunately this place has a TERRIBLE pad thai.  I ordered the pad thai with tofu, and the wait was only 15 mins for take-out (which is awesome) but the food was so terrible I only picked a small piece out to taste and I didn't even bother taking it out of the container.  I threw the entire thing away before even having a full bite, the pad thai tasted like fish and the tofu looked oddly half fried, half I don't know what they did.  I will definitely not go back to this place.
author: Erica D.

description: My favorite restaurant for delivery in Russian Hill. I love their boiled banana in coconut milk dessert. Mmmm. And they get an extra star for actually having brown rice.
author: Cindy R.

description:
I've been going here for almost a decade.   

Try the egg rolls (like spring rolls).  Excellent.  The basil chicken is also very good.

The ambiance is great for a night out with close friends or for a first date :)

Parking can be tricky but the food is worth it.
author: Tara G.

description: Best authentic Thai food in town.  Great prices and an extensive menu.  They'll make it spicy like Thai food should be spicy.  Your mouth will be on fire, but you'll be eating the real deal.  Also, they'll make their spring roll fresh (not fried) if you ask - and it's delicious.  Only downside, is that it can get pretty loud in there as the evening rolls on and the seats fill up.  My suggestion - go early and during the week.
author: Lisa A.

description: Good as far as thai gets.  Quite frankly I wished that the portions were true to those usually served in thai restaurants.  That being said, thai is thai as sf fog is sf fog.  The specials, esp. the salmon in red curry rocked.
author: Susan K.

description: Lemongrass is super good and pretty inexpensive.  I am always full and happy when I leave.  The food comes promptly and if you get a window table it is a fun place to people-watch.  Check it out!!  Mmmm...
author: Rachel R.

description: Went here last night with a few of my friends.  Not bad at all.  We had one dish that was hot.  It was a good temp of spice for the whole table.  I personally would like it much hotter but when sharing it was well worth it.
author: Doreen D.

description: Like my review for Little Thai, I think Lemongrass had good food in-person. But unlike Little Thai, my BF and I thought the food from delivery was horrible! We were given bland noodles with virtually no sauce as "pad see eew" and the pineapple fried rice had to be at least a day old. Not to mention it took nearly 1.5 hours to deliver to us. We were unimpressed on every level.
author: Sally M.

description:
Would probably put this restaurant into the category of worst Thai food ever.

Walked in and were quickly seated.  However, there was a smell of urine in the air.  We assumed it might be from the baby that was sitting at another table but it sure didn't leave when the baby did.  However, that smell was quickly overpowered by the smell of burning food coming from the kitchen.

I ordered Tom Yum which is always an indicator to me of the quality of the Thai food I can expect.  It was ok, however was definitely light on the lemongrass.  Main courses were not memorable, not one of the 3 in my party bothered finishing what was served and we certainly were not foolish enough to ask to take it home.

This is another one I would advise you not waste your time going to.
author: Vicky C.

description: Went in the other day and ordered chicken noodle soup.. Big production asking for basic  HOT SAUCE-- stated they have that at vietnamese restaurant Only= WHAT are you serious they gave me a mixed concoction of crap.. Bad attitude and RUDE RUDE RUDE.. I didn't even leave 50 cents for a tip.. I am a San Francisco native take that crappy service and crapy soup elsewhere. Never will I be back !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Athena C.

description: My review of Lemongrass is not close in time to my visit there but I remember it being average. My husband used to live close by and suggested that we go but what I ordered did not get me high on excitement. I'll probably have to come back to try once more.
author: Alexandra D.

description: I was skeptical as it doesn't look like a place you go solo but I had a good meal and the service was great.   The food was very flavorful and filling.  I heard it was a great thai place and I agree.  Seems like a place you'd maybe go on a date.
author: John B.

description: I love Thai food and decided to try this place, which is close to work for lunch.  I was really disappointed - flavors were just o.k. and the service that day was really inconsistent.
author: Annabel G.

description:
I called 4 Thai places yesterday before calling Lemongrass to try and find delivery Thai at lunch.  None of them would deliver besides Lemongrass, so I was very grateful to them for their delivery.
I ordered the pumpkin curry with prawns, which was surprisingly good.  Almost as good, in fact, as Citizen Thai's signature pumpkin curry.  So far, 4 stars.
But wait.
It ain't over till Natalie is full.
I also ordered the green papaya salad.  Big mistake. Or actually, not a mistake on my part, a mistake on their part. It tasted like it had been sitting in a hyper-cold fridge somewhere for 48 hours.  This was very disappointing, for a salad that cost nearly $7.00 and consists of fruit, peanuts, and what looked like green beans.  I can't be sure if they were green beans because the whole thing had a homogeneous flavor by the time it reached me.  Even the peanuts were soggy.
Yes, dear Yelp audience, I received soggy peanuts. 
I still give them three stars, for the curry, the fact that my rice was still warm, and the lunch delivery.
author: Natalie K.

description: Whoa...why all the hate on Lemongrass? I've been eating here for years, and have never been disappointed. Definitely try the crispy rice salad. It's the perfect blend of sweet and savory, with an array of different interesting textures. Really a stand out. On my last visit, I had the prawn and pumpkin curry, which was fabulous. Prices are extremely reasonable, too. Great restaurant for a night out on a budget.
author: Brianne K.

description:
I only had curries so far in this place so I do feel bad to review this place by just having their curries, but well, they do make Thai curries quite good.  

Not too much of coconut milk, although everyone has his/her own preference.  Flavors were kept right and vegetables were not overcooked (that's what you need to watch out with Thai curry, you really don't have to "cook" vegetables in Thai curry...)  But I have to note that cooking this kind of curries is not THAT hard either.  

I will go back there for more dishes to try.  A bit fancy but it's in Russian Hill so I guess it's alright...
author: T T.

description: Very good Thai food, especially the thai appetizer (i think that what its actually called).  Decent atmosphere and helpful staff guide you through the selection of noodles, curries and salads. Take out is quite fast also.
author: Inga R.

description: I am not even a fan of thai food,but I had a delightful lunch here last Sunday.The Tom Yum Goong was the perfect mixture of sour and spicy. I had another dish that had a green curry and assorted sea food that was excellent.Prices were reasonable.I will definitely come back here
author: Lauren V.

description: Last night I was delighted once again by delicious food and the  wonderful service and atmoshpere at this very special place. The service is always very attentive and the staff friendly. I have had a number of entrees there and they are all good but.... The asparagus lovers dish with shrimp and scallpos is incredible.  It has just the right combination of spices and the vegtables were perfectly cooked. Made me want to lick the sauce off the plate. This is my favorite dish.  The apetizer combo is really good and I can't rember the name but the spinach leaves with roasted coconuts, peanuts and lime with ginger sauce is mouthwatering. Even though I was stuffed I couldn't resist the fried bananna with ice cream. It's a cute place who's employees and owner take great pride in what they offer. One of the best Thai restaurants I have been to.
author: Jon E.

description: Tasty (and bargain-priced) thai food in a charming atmosphere makes Lemongrass a great neighborhood destination for a weeknight dinner.  The Poh-Pier-Sod (#2) is a nice 'n fresh little appy which I must order every time I eat there...AND they deliver...
author: Katie C.

description: The taste, service, and price at Lemon Grass were great, but let's just say the food had everyone in my group a little 'bubbly."  It didn't set well, to say the least.  But tasty.  It may just be that the food is very rich...
author: Joe R.

description: Alright.  I admit when i am wrong, and i was wrong about Lemongrass.  Their food is great, and upon a couple more experiences their service (specifically delivery) is better than i first thought.  Check this place out if you live in the northeast part of the city.
author: Robert R.

description: I have only ever had delivery from here, but have had zero complaints.  The food is delicious and hot.  And I mean that in terms of serving temperature and the spiciness.  Sometimes the curry really packs a wallop.  Yummy green papaya salad - enough for 3 people easy.  The prawn and pumpkin curry was delish.  I've never ordered the same thing twice (other than the salad) and have always been pleased.
author: darla s.

description: Just had Lemongrass for the first time yesterday. I was able try quite a few things, all of which were wonderful - the chicken satay, the egg roll, the Tom Yum soup, the Thai toast and the Kee Mow noodles. Very affordable, and they deliver! Unfortunately afterward I got a massive headache that 99.9% of the time means MSG. Based on that I won't be back.
author: Sarah R.

description: Cute, traditional, down to earth thai place that would've been overlooked if I weren't taken there by a neighborhood friend.  There is nothing flashy or pretentious about this place, it's just good thai food and hospitable thai service.  My favorite dish we ordered was the tofu basil, yum.
author: Debbie Y.

description: I've been here three times and can't really remember much about any of the visits. Since they weren't very memorable, I guess that rates the restaurant three stars. The only thing I do remember was I actually ate multiple egg rolls, which I usually avoid because I find them flavorless (unless you like the flavor of fried), so that must mean the egg rolls at Lemongrass were good, right?
author: Rebecca H.

description: Lemongrass is a reliable, Thai place with fast delivery and almost a guarantee to get a seat inside. The service is always nice, too. I've had better Thai food at other restaurants in the city, and I've never had anything here that is amazing to be honest, but the food is reliably good and a safe bet. Particularly convenient if you live in Russian Hill.
author: Larissa M.

description: This was our first visit to Lemongrass and we will definitely be back. The food was delicious and the prices were good too.  We had the traditional shrimp Pad Thai, spicy calamari with bamboo shoots, and the eggplant with tofu. The atmosphere is very nice and the wait staff were all very pleasant.  We can't wait to try the many other dishes they offer and would definitely recommend this neighborhood restaurant to friends.
author: Monica L.

description: Good thai food-- I remember having a really tasty coconut milk soup. They will deliver to Tonic next door, and if you're nice to the bartender, he/she will let you eat at the bar.
author: shoba d.

description: I have been here a few times.  While it's not bad, I think I prefer the other Thai places along Polk St.  I always use my favorite dish, Pad See U, as a guide.  Here it comes with soft rather than fried tofu.  That is probably healthier, but it wasn't as tasty.  It was also loaded with veggies, but they seemed like they could have been cooked a bit longer.  Apparently the chef last night was also worried about vampires because I am still tasting like garlic today.  The sauce and noodles were tasty, but overall it's not my favorite version of the dish in the neighborhood.
author: Squirrel L.

description: The food was not good.  This place is one that serves pad thai with the orange/red sauce.  I am not a fan.  We also got this salad that was actually pretty good, however, from the description I thought we would be getting lettuse wraps.  The garlic beef was also not good and made me sick.  I probably wont be going again.
author: Jaime C.

description: I would give lemongrass a 2 and half if I could. I ordered delivery and the woman I spoke with was sooo rude, but she said to expect the food in 40 minutes and it came in 20 so that redeemed her somewhat. The phad broccoli is good but its kinda hard to screw up broccoli, the panang nuer in red curry was alright, I should have done the chicken red curry instead though, the beef was really dry and thick, the curry itself wasn't bad though, that being said, Oshas was better plus they don't give you a very big portion. The sweet and sour chicken was ok but was also a very small size, the chicken fried rice was no good and the crispy rice salad wasn't exactly what I expected and kinda had a funny taste. Overall it wasn't awful but i will probably order Thai from somewhere else next time.
author: Meg L.

description: 2 1/2 stars if I could. Don't get the BEEF Phad See Yew. The meat is overcooked and super rubbery. I felt like I was chewing rubber bands. I like my phad see yew with less veggies and more noodles as well. My roommate got the chicken and loved it though. The appetizers were great, the ambiance is cool and the service was pretty decent.
author: Tien H.

description: they have this sizzling chicken with a crazy peanut sauce that they sprinkle crack on so you can't stop eating it.  I dig this place, that chicken plate, the curry (i'm a greenie), and the eggplant all rock my world.  it's my favorite thai place
author: Chrammy D.

description:
This is the very first restaurant I ate at in San Francisco while apartment hunting, and I am very happy to know that I have a place to get good Thai only a couple blocks from my apartment. 
We had the appetizer platter, the special (which was a mixture of seafood in a peanutty type sauce) and some red curry chicken. It was all delicious. Contrary to some other reviews regarding greasiness I was relieved to find Thai that was so flavorful and not at all greasy, nor drowned in sauce. All the ingredients seemed very fresh and the sauces were well balanced, testing your pallete to discern the distinct flavors without being overwhelming. 
The waitstaff were friendly and courteous, the decor simple and inviting, but the food was the real standout. Loved it, definitely recommend. However, since this is my first sampling of Thai food in the city I am giving it 4 stars while I search for the elusive 5 star Thai place.
author: Megan G.

description: Phad Thai is good...I went with the tofu last time because the chicken was WELL DONE the first round.  They have decent curry too.
author: Lisa D.

description: 77. PAD MAKUER TOFU and the Redy & Yellow curry are awesome! Some of the best Thai cuisine in SF!!
author: Sameer N.

description: Great neighborhood Thai place. The specials are always worth ordering. Also the fried rice dishes and soups are very good.
author: Amy S.

description: Don't ever have them cater.  I ordered for 14, and maybe got enough for 8.  It was early and cold by the time it got here.
author: E R.

description: I've only catered through Lemongrass and I have to say it's been great for every occasion.  You can interchange items from the catering menu and our guests enjoyed their Pad Thai, egg rolls and curry chicken dishes.  (I did too!)  Also, the price is very reasonable when catering to larger parties.  (It's always more than enough food so keep that in mind when ordering)
author: Jeff A.

description: With the exception of the catering review, I have to side with all of the other reviewers who gave Lemongrass a high rating.  Great Thai food, their specials menu is also good, and I'm actually thinking of my Christmas eve dinner there right now as we speak.  Great meal, do yourselves a favor and dine there if you're in the mood for some chill Thai before catching a flick at AMC 1000 or doing what ever you do on Russian Hill.
author: Jonathan V.

description: Delicious and affordable, you can't go wrong with the Tom Kha Pak Tofu, which I get whenever I'm craving veggies that taste like they're straight out of the garden. The rich coconut broth, galanga, lemon leaves and lime juice all make it extra craveable. Even though I'm as gringa as they come, this has become my soul food.
author: Shannon R.

description: I ordered take-out so this review is only for the food. 1 star extra for prompt and friendly delivery. The food, however, is awful. I've had Thai from many different places but this is easily the worst Thai food ever tasted. The pad Thai was dry. The yellow curry was watery. And the panang nuer had extremely dry meat. It was a waste of money. I starved the entire evening because the food was too disgusting to swallow. Fast food would've been more satisfying--and I happen to hate fast food.
author: Faye S.

description: Good food, for a very reasonable price. I thought the seating was a little cramped but probably the norm for SF.
author: Dave K.

description: Consistency is king when it comes to having a regular favorite right?  Well, that and proximity to your home.  For both of these reason I *heart* Lemongrass.  Quality taste, great sauces, and a nice atmosphere for lunch will keep me coming back.  They fall short on only one dish I like a lot. It involves rice noodle which they always seem to overdo.  Friendly folks as well.
author: Brad C.

description: OK, so I recently moved to the Russian Hill neighborhood and realized quickly that there are 101 different Thai places to eat at.  Not literally 101, but tons it seems.  Lemongrass is definitely worth a visit if you're in the mood for fairly cheap Thai food with a warm and cozy atmosphere.  The food wasn't the best (hence the non-five star review), but the service and cozy atmosphere were worth a mention and at least 3 stars.  All in all, come here for cheap food (b/w 8-11 buckaroons) and fast service.
author: Ryan R.

description: I've had much better Thai in the City. It used to be better too, I suspect a new chef.
author: Ben R.

description: Good food at reasonable prices.  Of course parking is a joke, as much of the city.  However this area is tougher than many other areas.  A nice enough atmosphere that is typical for a Thai restaurant.  I recommend a window seat if you want to watch all the eye candy coming from the gym down the block!
author: Scott A.

description:
By far the best Thai food I ever had. The portions are just right, the prices are really good and the food is a perfect balance of flavors. I've been there about 15 times and I've never been disappointed.
The only downfall, the parking situation in this area of the city is painful.
author: S. M.

description: This is one of my FAVORITE Thai places in the city. Everything I've had there (I am vegetarian) is excellent. Go here! It's Awesome! Dessert is good too!
author: Angela D.

description: Probably the worst Thai I had in SF... or anywhere for that matter. The folks who run this place are really friendly and all, but out of the 4 dishes we had only one was mediocre at best.  Maybe it was a bad night or something, but I don't really understand how so many people are giving it 4 or 5 stars.
author: yoni s.

description: Wow.  Definitely the best Thai I've had in CA.  Second in the world only to this little Thai place outside of Cambridge, England (can you say pumpkin yellow curry?  i didn't think so.)
author: George K.

description: Not your typical Thai.  Toi has amazing authentic recipes.  My favorites are Thai stick & green curry (KANG KEAW WAN) with chicken.  The dine-in atmosphere is nice; not too bright, warm, fast service and inexpensive.  Their delivery is fast as hell (then again I don't live too far away).  This place is a Russian Hill gem and makes me love this neighborhood!
author: Melani R.

description: I was in the area going to Cole Hardware and decided to grab a bite to eat at Lemongrass. Having just moved here, I don't have much of a frame of reference yet, but I was pretty impressed with the food to say the least. Great portions (even for lunch), attentive staff, and the prices! For the money, I'll definitely go back if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: David H.

description: Tasty food and friendly service! The tofu basil is SO good. We also ordered the pumpkin prawns, pad thai and one of the milk soups. I thought it was all very good, but some of my group didn't like the prawns. I will definitely be back. Plus, I hear they deliver!
author: Lizzie S.

description: I love this place! I have brought a couple different friends here who lived in Thailand for a couple months, and they agree! I live super close to it, so I have brought them a lot of business in the last year and a half. The service is amazing. You will never have an empty glass, and the waitresses are always friendly. The atmosphere is calming and serene, with low lighting and light music. The Tom Kha Gai has great flavor. I just can't seem to get enough of the Kang Ka Ree (yellow curry with chicken) because I get it almost every time I go. Also, check out the mango with sticky rice dessert.  The combination of the cool mango and the warm, slighty sweet rice is so interesting, and surprisingly delicious! On top of the food being great and the attentive service, the prices are very affordable. I'm sure I'll be making my way over there again soon!
author: Darby B.

description: Service is terrible in this place. Had to get up to get a menu myself after a ten minute wait and it never got better. Food is OK (not great however) but the service bordered on the insulting.
author: art a.

description: This is a charming restaurant on Polk street in Russian Hill. The wait staff is very friendly and the atmosphere inside is very cozy. The food is good but nothing to write home about. I usually order for delivery but occasionally eat inside. It's always very predictable - tasty enough to please the appetite. Good for dates or with a few friends for dinner on a smaller budget. Good value.
author: Carter F.

description: What's not to love about Thai food, especially here. I usually take to-go, but the service is prompt and the food is excellent.
author: Andrew C.

description: driving from yosemite national park to san francisco as a detour back to los angeles stopped at lemongrass...thanks to yelp which helped find this place very easily- from the middle of the sidewalk-  ordered the chicken basil pepper #28. veggie rolls. chicken satay. thai iced tea. beer. water. everything was delicious. the food was so good my mouth is watering and there's nothing I can do short of a 6 hour drive back to sf for more lemongrass. boxed leftovers were enjoyed on the road. yummmmy.
author: Kenda H.

description: Yummy eggplant tofu, yummy fried banana with honey and  ice cream and nice service.
author: Diane M.

description:
parking = bad.  food = good.  service = aight.  price = reasonable.  ambiance = "datey".

got adventurous and tried the pad thai and pad see ew.  actually, they say you can always judge a thai restaurant from the staple standards.  both dishes were pretty tasty, and not overly-[insert word here, e.g. dry, saucy, skimpy, spicy, etc].  goodness was evidenced by the lack of take-out boxes at the end of the meal.

the specials sounded really good, must try them next time!
author: Cory C.

description: I've been here twice now and both times it has been delicious.  For the price I don't think you can do better if your in the mood for some tasty thai food.  The first time I went I ate in the restaurant and the second time was for take out.  When I ate there the service was friendly and quick (enough.)  When I got take out it was during rush hour on Friday night and although I barely had to wait the staff (including someone I think was the owner) kept apologizing.
