These apologizes were entirely unneccessary in my opinion because the food was done in plenty of time and was still toasty hot when I got it home.  And I won't lie, I ate the entire order of spring rolls... Worth every calorie.
author: Mackenzie B.

description: I keep giving Lemongrass a try once every four months, but then I remember why it's never at the top of my list: small portions, not flavorful or spicy enough, and otherwise underwhelming. When I'm in the mood for asian food, I go across the street to Aux Delices. Definitely more bang for my buck.
author: Macheeks ..

description:
This is definitely my go-to restaurant for Thai Food.  Their noodles, curry, and soup are ALWAYS fantastic.  I recently tried the beef salad, and will probably be ordering that every time from now on.

Quick service, decent prices.  Love it
author: Allie P.

description: I am truly saddened that yelp doesn't have 6 stars... This Place deserves an extra star for sure!!! Nestled in Russian hill, is this little piece of heaven called Lemongrass... I am always treated like a prince here!!  The staff are the kindest people around, they are very patient and i don't feel rushed in anyway. Then when my food arrives the waitress places my dinner napkin on my lap.. I ordered the Beef Kee-mow which was so delicious!! You know the food is good when you receive a huge plate and the last bite was just as good as the first and you desire more.. I ordered just a scoop of vanilla ice cream for desert, but it refreshed my taste buds once more.. I feel like I've committed a yelp crime by giving other places 5 stars, this truly does deserve 6! I have eaten at restaurants that are $200 a plate and haven't received service like this. The food was so fresh and the music was peaceful. Such a calm and relaxing environment, I will definitely come back for more!!!!
author: Bradley P.

description: Pleasantly surprised!! Recently ordered take out (egg rolls, red prawn curry and mango sticky rice) for the first time and couldn't have been happier. Delivery was quick, food was warm, fresh and delicious.
author: christina d.

description:
totally my go-to thai place. everything i've had here is really good (except this one eggplant/vegetable/fish thing) and i love their pad thai. i am picky about pad thai, and this one is good. they also don't look at you sideways when you ask to add broccoli to it. 

when you call for pickup, it's ready in 15 minutes, even on busy nights. 

it's always a casual neighborhood crowd, and the service is friendly.
author: rachel r.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant on Polk St! Food is consistently excellent. Service is prompt. Not over-priced. A great local spot.
author: Jessica E.

description: Blahhh stay away from this place. The food here is just plain bad. I ordered delivery here this past Sunday. Out of the four dishes we ordered four of them where bad. I mean come on, how can you get Pad Thai wrong. Delivery took over an hour, and they added a $5 delivery fee (even though on the menu cover it says free delivery). Because it was a rainy Sunday I still gave a 25% tip. Little did I know the food would come cold and tasteless. The Pad Thai came as a solid lump of impenetrable ball of noodles. The Panang beef was watery and tasted old. The Rad Nar was also watery and boring. Pad Kee Mao was just plain bad. For some reason all the dishes were served on wax paper inside the to go boxes. So when you went in for a bite you would get a nice serving of wax paper along with your food. Not sure if the chef was having a bad day, or what but, I would stay away from this place. At least on rainy Sundays for delivery it is definitely not recommended!
author: Howard C.

description:
I thought the food overall was good, not the best Thai food I have had but definitely some of the better food. It was a great selection of foods from Pad Makuer to Larb Kai salad, all of which I eat regularly when I am out to indulge in my Thai cravings. I was out with a group of four so we had the pleasure of trying a number of different dishes and can say that we spread our wealth across the menu.

Of note were the Thai Combo appetizers especially the Thai Sticks, which fair like in name where quite well put together and tasted like lightly fried and well seasoned prawns wrapped in a light shell. Very good. Other items that were good was the Larb Kai salad and the Pad Thai, very standard food but nonetheless very good.

The service was good, as the waitress was attentive and helpful in taking our orders and making sure our beer and water supply never ran out. She was not as helpful in assisting with the myriad of choices and what she liked best. She seemed to recommend the entire , which of course was the problem in the first place, just too many good choices. Overall though, service was good.

The atmosphere and decor were upscale compared to most Thai places and I was impressed with the overall feel of the place. Very relaxing. However, when crowded it is small and thus got noisy.

The only real knock on this place is the price of the food, while note outrageous for a SF meal, it was pricey for comparable Thai meals. I have had better Thai food for less and I have had more Thai food for less, but overall I would recommend this for Thai food in the Polk (Russian Hill) area of town. I was overall satisfied with the entire experience.
author: Charles T.

description: Great Thai food.  I've tried the stuffed chicken wings, beef larb, pad thai, and curry.  All were exceptional.  Nice neighborhood (Russian Hill) to walk around after a quick meal.
author: John c.

description:
Generally, very reliable and tasty Thai food, but I recently had a delivery of Green Curry Beef with a very strange type of meat.  I've had this dish many times and this time the beef was definitely different.  It had a pick tint and was very chewy.  After eating a few pieces, I was convinced that it was not beef.  I called the restaurant and they told me that it was beef, just a different type - better quality they said.  However, I am very suspicious of what it actually was.  I could not eat the meal, and if I order from Lemongrass again, I will definitely avoid the beef.

I find this to be a bit odd, because I've had Lemongrass 20-30 times and never had one complaint until this.
author: Brett B.

description: Love, LOVE the pumpkin curry.  Everything else is OK, not great, but the pumpkin curry is friggen awesome.
author: David M.

description: yummie food and not too expensive. This is a place you don't go for the atmosphere but for the good food. and they do a good job, also the service is great
author: Cianna X.

description: Lemongrass is one of countless Thai restaurants on Polk street. Yes, inside you will find charming authentic Thai decorations, but beware- the place is cramped and it is rather easy to knock over and break artwork and dishes (as I managed to do even before sitting at our table). The wait staff is extremely friendly (yet slow moving) and greeted us with a "sawadee-ka"upon entering. After squeezing into our table we perused the menu and decided on pad kee mow with chicken, vegetable tom yum, panang curry with beef and squash and steamed mussels for Kenny. The soup came first, lukewarm, and slightly fishy tasting with tofu and vegetables. Definitely not the best tom yum by a long stretch. Steamed mussels followed suite, floating in an aromatic basily broth, which was actually better than the tom yum. The pad kee mow was passable, but nothing special and definitely not as spicy as I would have preferred. Usually I expect pad kee mow to have lettuce and tomatoes and chili, but this one came topped with bean sprouts, peppers, and onions. The noodles were not terribly tasty- not nearly as good as the noodles at Little Thai, which is just down the street (then again that was pad see ew, but similar dishes nonetheless). The panang beef with squash was okay, but again, I've had better curries than this. Overall I'd say this place is decent, but I probably wouldn't come again since Little Thai is so close, and so much better.
author: Kate A.

description: The worst  thom ka ghai soup I've ever had.  The soup has no thai taste to it.  No lemongrass, fish sauce and spices in the soup with very little chicken meat.  The delivery took over an hour with no utensils and condiments included.  The price is overpriced for the quality of food.  I would not recommend this restaurant to any of my friends.
author: Edward p.

description: I'm not a huge fan of Thai....so much greasy Thai in this city. But this place is awesome. I've never had anything bad here. Fresh quality ingredients. Just awesome and they deliver.
author: Becca F.

description: lemongrass is a great little neighborhood thai place.  its not my go-to delivery place, but the food is really good and i like eating there.  most recently i went with friends for dinner, and had a great meal.  we started with the appetizer combo - spring rolls, chicken sate, and shrimp.  all were good and it wasnt so large that you didn't have room for your entree.  i had the beef with vegetables - delicious and simple.  very fresh tasting.  my friend had the pumpkin curry which i shared, i like the combination of flavors.  good spot for a thai meal you know is going to be good!
author: Carolyn B.

description: this place has very solid thai food. the shrimp is always what i set the standard by. and they were pretty big and fresh, with just the right amount of chewiness. i had the pumpkin shrimp curry, which was delicious. and the beef broccoli chow fun--which isn't really a thai noodle, but whatever, it was that perfect chewy-stick-to-your ribs noodle. my favorite was the chicken lemongrass soup, sweet and spicy perfection with loads of chicken in it.
author: rachel p.

description: big fan of lemongrass.  whether it is dine in or take out, the food is always fabulous, timely and this place never seems too crowded. i enjoy the beef red curry, coconut green curry and the sauce that comes with the veggie spring rolls.  the pumpkin curry is bomb.  yum. yum.
author: Natalie H.

description: My friend and I had a craving for Vietnamese Pho, but Aux Delices was closed so we crossed the street and entered Lemongrass. While waiting for the waitress to take our order my friend and I occupied our time by trying to kill this huge fly that was circling our table. She finally killed it with a box from Walgreens. When we told he waitress about the fly -she did not seem surprised which worried me.  Was she use to customers regularly killing flies?  We then ordered two different types of noodle soups. I ordered the Lemongrass special and my friend ordered a similar seafood soup.  When we received our orders I remarked to her "hey your soup is PINK".  She proceeded to taste it but sent it back after two minutes because of the smell -she could not stand the smell. Fortunately for me I had a cold that day. She ordered the pad Thai to replace her "stinky soup". Everything was pretty good after that. Overall -I probably would not eat here again.
author: Kat F.

description: Ok, it's true that the location is one of the best things that lemograss has to offer (the people watching is phenomenal because if you go at the right time you get the post-crunch AND the pre-Tonic crowd-- good times :)... but it's one of those places where if you ask for it spicy they turn it UP.  Which is so rare but SO appreciated.  Veggies: I recommend the param pak (that's right I ask for it by name), spicy mixed vegetable tofu - DELICIOUS!
author: Anjali K.

description: Easily some of the most average Thai food we have ever had.  We live close by, so we have tried it several times and we are not sure how they stay in business.  Best in the area bar none: Citizen Thai & The Monkey Bar in North Beach.  If not, Little Thai a little further down Polk.
author: michael d.

description: The food here is awesome.  The portions are satisfying and the prices are relatively cheap.  The eggplant and seafood special is incredible.
author: Brooks O.

description:
i think this place may be one of the best thai places in russian hill. the pluses are that the place is toasty, the window seats are fun, the food is moderately good, and the ambience is pretty nice. the minuses are that it can get exceedingly loud and the staff can sort of pushy about ordering, asking for drinks, and coming to pick up the check. in fact, it was sort of stressful to be there. i've never been bowled over by the food, but maybe they don't do great veggie dishes??

warning: lunch delivery is a nightmare. it took over an hour and 15 minutes and the food wasn't hot ar even that tasty.
author: joseph j.

description: This place is great..why? The food is excellent, inexpensive and the restaurant has a great ambience. You can definately go here on a first date. The staff is very nice. Parking is impossible in this area, so make sure you are on foot.
author: Niko P.

description: 2 1/2 stars really. Kind of mediocre and bland. There are better Thai options in this neighbourhood.
author: Colin M.

description: Ordered from the catering menu for a party of 12.  We had never been to lemongrass but reviews seemed ok.  It was also hard to find a thai restaurant with a catering menu so we called lemongrass.    For $14.50 per person we got chicken satay (only 1 each!) Chicken Curry, Beef Pepper, Pad Thai, Salad and rice.    The food arrived close to the arranged time with each dish in its own tray which worked perfectly for us. Most of the food was good.      Only complaint was that the chicken curry had virtually no chicken and no potatoes.   It was a big tray of curry broth.   It almost looked like they forgot to add the chicken.    I sent an email to Toi letting her know how we liked almost everything and to complain about the curry broth we received, have yet to hear back.
author: Kevin C.

description: Just a normal thai place, nothing that exciting, nicer interior, good crowd. Wairtresses were pushy and not helpful. Food was good.
author: Sarah R.

description: Great take out.   The restaurant is nice but I prefer the take out.  It's delivered fast and is always delicious and affordable.  A great option for movie night in.
author: mary w.

description: If you order the beef and peanut  sauce with spinach.....be prepared for the spinach to have all the stems attached. Yuck.
author: Angela C.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant in the CIty. Friendly service, clean restaurant, tasty food. The value is unbeatable, amazing that you can still go out to a nice restaurant with propor seating and service for $7.95.... Never tried their delivery service.
author: Peter J.

description: i've been here a couple of times and i'm always impressed with their food. i had a grilled beef dish that had this lime dipping sauce that was to die for. its a great date spot too. they don't have too much of a wine selection but the food is always consistently good.
author: Miss O.
